6rEuQTIShlMCYaP0P-bOqg.text: Love this place!  The pickled cabbage that comes with the chips and salsa are my favorite.  Big selection for the money.

nsn9svdgGKBBOF4Ny2Lwhg.text: This place offer large portion of food, nice service but the complementary chips/salsa was not fresh and the food was not extraordinary. I am not going back anytime soon.

u4Jjy3vc8Ok9TSOwMBlBIg.text: As of now this is my favorite Mexican restaurant!  I love this place!  Every time I go to Charlotte I make sure to go here!  Not only is the atmosphere here wonderful but so are the people!  The queso (cheese dip) is phenomenal.  The chips and salsa are great as well, it even comes with what I believe is Mexican coleslaw (I could be wrong on the name but it's some type of Mexican salsa lettuce thing) but I love to mix it into the salsa.  Although I may be eating it wrong, I definitely recommend mixing it with the salsa.  I always the pitcher of margaritas here.  Now if you're splitting it between two people you may not be able to finish it, it's strong and larger than it appears!  Be warned!   I think it's about 7 margaritas (or more) but it's a good amount for the price for sure! Moving on to the food mmmm delicious!  I have only ordered the tacos here so far because I'm so hooked on them I always get one soft and one hard chicken taco.  Usually at most Mexican restaurants I've been to the soft taco is always soggy because of all the juices coming from the chicken, but here it was perfectly moist and juices didn't drip down to my elbow lol.  The perfected the chicken taco! My experiences here have been nothing but great so definitely make your way here if you love Mexican and margaritas!

LdP2P6mqhBvg_W9ezWvvnA.text: Got very full eating here. Food was great. Was surprised with the free dessert at the end. Got steak fajitas for $13 after tax. Would come back again. Waitress was really nice too. Chip and salsa were free too.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

t2a1nkRJ4cqnRlxU6TDrpw.text: Went here in Yesterday (Aug 2016) with a crowd of 12. It was about 3:00pm. We were seated immediately and they took drink orders right then. I went to wash up and by the time I got back my drink was at the table. We ordered shortly after and we were served very quickly with really good food. It was authentic Mexican food. I have had better salsa but my Deluxe Burrito was awesome. Everyone loved their food and I can't speak highly enough about the service. Our Waiter was friendly and fast. Great experience.

TjPnTRcZw7mjs18M5loIbA.text: Ok service, not prompt, but friendly. House margarita, big as yo face, portions big as yo face. As far as taste, it satisfies. It is defiantly real Mexican food. Did it blow my mind? No. Would i come back? Most likely. By no means the best, by no means the worst.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

zPICyTrbLuWCuTBbvsl1RQ.text: So I have to update my previous review from a 4 to a 2 and echo what a lot of other reviewers are experiencing - what the hell happened, Azteca?  While they have updated and spruced up the interior, quite honestly the food is not as good as it used to be and the newer staff needs some more training.  I know I am a fatty, but if I come in at 11:30 am, I expect lunch portions and lunch prices.  On a Thursday visit, I did get an extra flauta (I thought the menu changed, I didn't realize the waitress had done a dinner order), however that was not a good thing.  The flautas used to be crispy with well flavored meat.  The shell for mine was mushy instead of crunchy and the beef was dry, tough and flavorless.  For $7.25 I would have been irritated enough - for $10, I was kind of pissed.  The rice and beans are the same eh, fine, they have always been, cheese dip was good.  The chips tasted different and not in a good way.  I don't eat the salsa, so I can't speak to that.  I did see a several people that have been there forever, but I did see a lot of new faces too.  From the other "meh" reviews and my past two experiences, I do believe I will be heading to 1900 for Mexican lunches and Monterrey for dinner - Azteca just isn't cutting it anymore.

sq5k7Mq74RdUJ5oQNKphKQ.text: Seriously good food.  Sat at the bar, had a couple top shelf margaritas- they were good - and beef fajitas.  The food was solid, tasty and authentic.  Good service too.  I'll be back for sure.

UvGEFXbtsP1MyfoOyBEJrw.text: The food here is great. There is a Mariachi band that plays Friday nights that is really fun! But don't waste your money on a pitcher of margaritas. They are not very strong, and very sugary! Probably go for a single top shelf margarita if you do!

8192oa6m46al5krDoSoHYA.text: Had a wonderful fajita salad w/beef last night - the steak was perfectly cooked and tender. Generous sides of avocado and everything. Staying at local hotel so had it to go - best 'traveling food' I've had in a while. They were busy and still got my order done in 10 mins.  Will be back!

uLfXTDtfEn2phckx_lc1DA.text: Was staying close by, a fifteen minute walk away. So worth the "dangerous, un-lit walk" (I was staying across the freeway and had to walk there) Fresh guac made right in front of the table so you get it tasty just to your buds! The waitress recommended everything, but said to try a little of everything the dish with steak,shrimp, and chicken (I forget the name) was best. It comes with beans and rice. SO GOOD! Wish they had a location in New York City, I'd be a constant costumer ;)

a0UF0I6pv0zqk4c9CtJeog.text: I visited Azteca while I was in the Charlotte area on a business trip and I am not sure what the hype is about. I am from Texas and know real Tex-Mex and this is not it!!!   I am rating the food 1 STAR and customer service/ambience 5 STARS.  Our waiter was very friendly and always had a smile on her face, I really liked her, but the food was very gross! My coworker and I shared the Fiesta Azteca which is a sampler platter and it was not very good. The chicken flautas were so dry drenching them in hot sauce didn't fix them! The potato skins were greasy and soggy, not crispy. And bacon wrapped shrimp were burned to prediction with a black charcoal taste! For a $26 appetizer, I was hoping for something more edible.   Will I be back? Yes, for the margaritas! NO FOR THE FOOD!

mRO1Wecg9yCbU7_ZGGjyow.text: I had a late dinner with a friend of mine and I was noticing the decor. Everything in the place is spot on clean there was no dust anywhere not in the table chandeliers not even in the exposed rafters. The music was authentic the food was fresh and everyone was very nice and cordial. This is a great place and I will be back.

OURg5k-gn1vVxBWWCUxBEg.text: Good food, Good price. We went around 4pm on a weekday, not very crowded, which is good. The meal protein was very big, both my husband and I got a doggy bag.I love the deep fried flour tortilla, it's flaky and delicious. Difintnaly will come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily special wall
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two combo dinner

6tg_WV5G6IemLsRorS57rg.text: Food was great!! My friend and I randomly chose this place for brunch one Sunday when we were both craving Mexican. We didn't see this coming but apparently it's a popular brunch place I mean seriously people were moving towards this place in hordes you would think they were giving away the food. We would have not waited but thankfully the patio was first come first serve so we were able to sit immediately due to everyone else seeming to be a large party. The service was just ok but honestly I think it was because they were basically under attack by the amount of people trying to eat there so not holding that against them they were just trying to survive at that point. Given the busyness of the place the food came out rather quickly and the micheladas we had were to die for. Definitely recommend this place and don't be scared away if it seems really really busy!

qG1PpKdyFPgOreiPaZjvxg.text: Best old-school Mexican restaurant in town. Service, quality of food, and ambiance all deliver above what we're all used to. Don't miss the Arroz Con Pollo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. From the bar area

PzerW9bU3K2a4qBNCWrf6Q.text: Unpretentious Mexican restaurant with good food (and lots of it--portions are huge) and quick but friendly service. My go-to order at Mexican restaurants is fajitas, and I really love the marinade they use at Azteca. The tableside guac is delightful and the margaritas are BIG. Skip the Mexican joints in the trendier parts of town and give Azteca a try.

HCmR0RDUUcEtXu4uNrAmbA.text: Just like a childhood movie favorite that is not quite as good when you revisit as an adult....Azteca did not hit the spot like it used to years ago in college. I had fond memories but when I visited a few week ago the food was greasy, over portioned and over cooked. The salsa was pleasantly flavorful but our entrees had a not so fresh suspect look about them.

qE2exjaqW3VN_wVnq5A-HQ.text: Meh...Three Amigos is my normal go to spot for Mexican food here in Charlotte.  But I was feeling a bit under the weather and decided to try this place out as it's closer to where I live.   Ample parking which I liked, but food a different story.  I ordered Small Combination plate with one taco & one enchilada.  I prefer care asada as my meat option, but I couldn't get it with this combo.  It's a different combination plate of 4 carne asada tacos 12.95.   So I choose shredded beef instead.   I did not try the guacamole.  The salsa tasted like hunts tomato sauce, and I didn't care for the shredded coleslaw they bring you.  Food came out and yes the portions are huge.  I ate very little.  Shredded beef tasted very bland in both the enchiladas and taco.   Rice I thought tasted mushy, but the beans were ok.  Won't be going back.  There are far better options for authentic Mexican food.  I'm sticking with Three Amigos.

A9aakq7G5SwcNJoO6w-UtA.text: Decor and staff were very nice, EVERYTHING else lacked luster.  Margarita poured from giant plastic container (not made fresh), tasting mostly of sour mix, bad tasting liquidy salsa, overly dried up rice, and WAY greasy tacos that completely fell apart.  Oh, and I asked for guacamole and it never came.  Would not go again.

rpdEbsda6ICRFCZuRRbk_g.text: This is one of my staple restaurants to take out of town guests to.  Their shrimp is huge, the food is consistently tasty, and the atmosphere and service are always on point.  My dad got the camerones de ajo (garlic shrimp).  I got the camerones a la diabla (spicy shrimp).  The garlic shrimp was awesome. It came with vegetables.  The spicy shrimp was ok... no veggies.  My dad got a margarita and was impressed with the size and strength of the alcohol in the drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice atmosphere
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside seating available
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Camerones

-3xoAULoIqw2MVA7oK7L0Q.text: My and my family's all time fave Mexican place. When we started going 15 years ago, it looked like a real hole in the wall. They've renovated and it's actually quite nice inside now. The front patio is the best place to sit when the weather is pleasant.  The portions are huge, so you really get a bang for your buck (this includes margs, sangria, and the draft beer. Make sure you hire a DD lol). You really can't go wrong with the menu, but some of my faves: Vegetarian burrito, deluxe burrito, Popeye quesadilla, seafood quesadilla, camerones con ongos (shrimp and mushrooms).  Tableside guac is a must. Queso is good too though. Of course, complimentary chips and salsa and pico, plus complimentary dessert (cinnamon toasted tortilla chips with honey, whipped cream, and strawberry sauce). Friendly and fast service. Parking may look small, but there's more in the back. Fun place to go for birthdays...free sundae and humiliation for the birthday guy or girl (they must wear a sombrero and be sung to by a mariachi band).

WrzhIygZt-3bwgmcWrW5ww.text: My friend ordered a chicken quesadilla. The concoction that was delivered had melted cheese all over the top of the tortilla and it was not cut into sizeable pieces. Nope, it was just one giant, soggy, tortilla with shredded chicken inside and melted cheese on top. Additionally, the service left me wondering if our waiter struggles with a deteriorated mental state. Among other strange interactions, we were asked the name of the employee who brought us a bowl of queso which we did not order. When we told the waiter that we did not know this individual's name, he promptly confiscated our bowl of queso, which was approximately 75% consumed already. We asked if we could finish the bowl and our request was denied. The waiter further explained that he was going to have to pay for the bowl of queso out of his own pocket. The whole scene, from the death metal that was playing when we walked into the restaurant to the waiter asking us to compare pictures of what was on our actual plates to pictures in the menu (which weren't similar at all), seemed like something out of the twilight zone.

l4e3Mq4eeB_yj2q5apbfwQ.text: Have eaten here a few times when I'm in town and the food is just wonderful. Only causes I have for complaint would be the horrible mariachi band that roams from table to table, interrupting both conversations and meals AND the last few times there's always some type of panhandler outside by the door or in the parking lot. The restaurant is right in front of a ratty Days Inn and not in the best part of town, which likely explains this. Personally, I wouldn't go there in the evening by myself, but two or more in a group offers a bit more protection. At any rate, the great food makes it all worth it.

1RKejLXKtAoloGsxa_2INw.text: We recently moved from the San Francisco bay area to Charlotte and we were so happy visiting this restaurant.  Great atmosphere inside and outside, good hostess and big shout out to our server who was very courteous   Don't forget to order the pitcher of Margarita   Big portions of food which was so delicious    Must go!!!

yb5HjjhORJTjPTqE3TKriA.text: Arrived from out of town and found this gem near our hotel. Food was good, but especially enjoyed the carved wood decor and all the staff wearing World Cup soccer shirts. Staff were friendly and attentive.

k0PRmJuGDKXf1jITdhxTMw.text: This is my go to place for a huge Mexican dinner and an awesome margarita. I usually get the large plate--and it's large! Mix of whatever you like, taco, enchilada with a lot of rice and beans covered in cheese on the side. You should always get a free fried dessert at the end... although the last time our server was not very friendly and didn't give us one. Usually their staff is friendly however.

ev3jLw49Tpt5wnc1eFeP-Q.text: The Mariachi band was great! However they would not let us sit outside despite it being completely empty and a beautiful day.

5RAYeKI5N1wvyoDFZpfKRQ.text: My husband and I came here last night to grab a quick dinner.  Chips and salsa came out fast (with some slaw that we didn't eat). The salsa was decent. A bit runny but the cilantro in it was flavorful.  We both ordered margs, as they were on special. Huuuuuge drinks! Very tasty. I could probably have handeled mine a bit stronger :)  We got the cheese dip as an appetizer. Very large portion that probably could have fed 8 but, of course, we devoured! It was very tasty and a good consistency (aka, not super congealed white stuff!).  We split the shrimp fajitas for dinner. Definitely plenty for two! They came with rice, beans, a small bit of guac, onions, peppers, and shrimp. Slightly dissapointed in the refried beans cause they were fairly flavorless. Plenty of shrimp to go around!  A-Ok meal!

FBlfLjNchrWCHgf8d9Vjzw.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte, very authentic food, large portions, good price, excellent service. The important facts: white queso is very good, chips always come out hot and fresh, they have a "soupy" salsa that is good with not a lot of heat, they also have a shredded cabbage salsa that is more "chunky." Highly recommend this place to anyone who wants some authentic Mexican food in Charlotte.

0H6x5kcwKar7p6vflUAG_g.text: Good food, nice space, BUT they do a TERRIBLE job at handling large reservations. Twice in the last year, they accepted our reservation for a group of 20-30 people, then when we showed up (on time, both times) they said very plainly and unapologetically that they had decided to give ALL of our reserved tables to other groups before we arrived. They didn't offer any solution other than  just waiting, and for 20-30 people, that meant waiting for at least an extra hour. So if you have a large group, don't bother trying to make a reservation here; and if you do, don't fool yourself into thinking not means anything.

NCcDHqhgM4ZZB3dBbAcXVg.text: I was staying at a hotel nearby, and most everyone says as Aztecca is the place to go for good Mexican food.  The outside is pretty lit up easy to find, inside looks like a typical Mexican place. The service was outstanding, however the food that I ordered fell a little short of my expectations. I Ordered the Carne Asada tacos, the upgraded one on the menu. When they came out the tortillas were soggy, I think they were supposed to be, but I just didn't care for that much. There wasn't a lot of Carne inside the tacos, and the pico de gallo was a strange lettuce combination that I also didn't very much care for.  The chips and salsa we're good however.

pBhkW3l-KXVxm_Nkk81mjg.text: I really don't understand why this place is packed at lunch time.  I ordered chili relleno and it's probably one of the worst rendition I have ever had. Rice and bean are average at best. Underneath the saltiness, the food was frankly tasteless. Salsa was very watery.  It was the first time I saw Shirley Temple and Roy Rogers on a Mexican restaurant's menu. Really?

kV1BhHnP_ITNmq41SOkZFg.text: Went here while in town for the weekend with a group of four, based on the great reviews.  Service was deplorable. Immediately got our drink order -- although a drink menu never showed, up so could order only what the server told us about. After drinks, was about 20 minutes before the waiter showed up again, to take our food order. The food came out and most of our group liked theirs. I found mine so-so, with the ribeye ordered medium rare and arriving somewhere between medium well and well done.   Our requested water for the table showed up about five minutes before it was time to leave, and we ran out of drinks about 20 minutes before our waiter checked in on us after our food got dropped off.  All in all, I've had better Mexican food, but I've far better service. Maybe ours was an anomaly, given all the other ratings, but I was pretty disappointed and probably won't repeat. Only highlight was the pleasant tableside guacamole service, although even they didn't ask as to spiciness level, something I'm used to from other restaurants that make fresh guac to-oder.

xNj8LTpgQEtTA1mZXlG2hg.text: Amazing service and food. Had the carne asada plate. They definitely give you your money's worth of food

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne asada is amazing!!!

HY1rxOTPDPQFi9LqrVrPgg.text: When someone at work says "Mexican for lunch?" They can always count me in!  My coworkers and I arrived a little after before noon and the parking lot was already packed. I was pleased that even though the lot was full there was no wait and we were seated immediately.   No sooner than we sat down we had a basket of chips and two different salsas. I really liked their salsa. I wasn't a fan of the chips because they were not served up hot but I ate them anyway because the salsa was just that good. Spicy and delicious...just like I like it.   The menu had great variety and the prices were excellent! I ordered the Deluxe Taco Salad with chicken - It comes in a tortilla shell with tomatoes, guacamole, sour cream and cheese.   Our food arrived so freaking fast! My goodness! What a major win for the very hungry lunch crowd!   My salad was just okay. Don't get me wrong, it was not bad by any means and the portion size was not a problem. It was the tortilla shell. It was not crispy like I'm used too but that's just my personal preference. I still loaded it up with salsa and enjoyed every bite.    For the prices this place is a great deal for lunch. I'd definitely come back, there's so much more I have to try...See ya soon Azteca!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deluxe Taco Salad

5qmFYqQhZdTpjzreD4H-8g.text: Friendly host and staff! Margaritas were amazing, I recommend the top shelf! The queso was very good, I could've taken some more heat though. Salsa was different, very liquidity but I also understand this is an authentic Mexican spot not the Tex-Mex I grew up on. I would've take more heat in the salsa as well, but I just really like spicy foods. Got the camarones Mexicanos and it was very good. Our server provided us with hot sauce that was perfect! Overall a great place to eat and quiet, not super glamorous in decor but that doesn't bother me.

462ii0XBMFhBBsHZEugg9w.text: Si se puede! Yes I can eat Mexican two days in a row. This was Round 2, a quick lunch with friends. Apparently the cure for a hangover is their house made sopa, so off we went to this spot I had no idea was even here, stuck on the side of a Days Inn. I have to say, I was really surprised. The decor is fantastic, I instantly forgot I was mere yards away from South Boulevard and was transported to a Mexican hideaway. While I was headed to work and stuck with water, my friend had a beer the size of his face (hair of the dog that bit him.)   The food was delicious. I had the Lunch Special #38- Avocado Tostada- and got a kick out of saying it- 38 Special! Ha! It was really delicious, even the rice and beans which I normally shove to the side. We enjoyed our sopapillas for dessert, and then had a quick photo shoot on the mechanical donkey by the front door. Sorry to say it's not plugged in, but it's good for a stationary picture! I will definitely be back- their dessert menu alone is tempting me!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sopapillas.

Kpxrj1k2jPxbmzitsheulw.text: I have been going to Azteca on Woodlawn since I was a little kid. It has always been my favorite mexican restaurant in Charlotte and never dissapoints! Their queso is the best and the chicken enchiladas are my go to dish! You  cant go wrong with anything on the menu

edgzYtFVMuMEp7W82VgKxg.text: I wasn't even in the mood for Mexican. I just needed a place to grab dinner near my hotel on a national holiday, and this place fit the bill. Wow - it is surprisingly good! Charming decor, good service, really fantastic carne asada. So happy that my hotel is way over on this side of town and that I stumbled across this place. :)

vCgLpA9TYcn5JAaZb7VcqQ.text: I LOVE AZTECA!! It's a definite on Cinco De Mayo this place is packed and the Margaritas are HUGE!!!   I love the hot fresh chips and they're salsa is good too!! I think this place is better than Cantina and it's definitely more authentic! I always get the same thing its a dish with shrimp and vegetables with rice and cheese sooooo good!!  The value that you get in unbelievable for 2 people it ends up to be $17 can't go wrong!!

H8aTBi7Shvg_Z7aYWFO2nQ.text: Affordable prices, good food and there was even a lady that made fresh guacamole right at the table; it was delicious.

pPB3U_4wnE2TXcdUTwZlYw.text: Seriously some damn good food here.  The place looks like a total crapfest from the outside, especially being right there at a hotel in a dubious neighborhood, but trust me, once you go in the weird doors (the entrance always seems like it's in a transitional state of construction) you'll feel like you just discovered a hidden gem!  The not-so-good: If you're not with a large group, I recommend asking for a booth, because they tend to crowd the tables a little close.  Sometimes it feels like they're pushing you to join another party the way the tables get too close.  And then there's the waiters... I've gone here dozens of times, and at least 75% of the time I've had a weird waiter ogle me.  Even when I've gone with my father! They can be kinda shameless. Wear a turtleneck if it'll bother you that much.  And then there's the good.. which far outweighs the negatives: Their food is freakin' amazing, and plentiful!  Expect to get a big basket of warm chips & salsas as soon as you sit down.. They'll keep filling that up as soon as it empties, but save room for the meal- the food is the star here! Their shredded beef is spiced perfectly. (Most dishes come with ground beef, but they will upgrade if you ask - and it's a million times better!)  I love their flautas, and their enchiladas. (I'm a sucker for a good enchilada!)  I highly recommend their enchiladas suizas (green sauce and cheese- really really good).  There's really nothing bad on the menu, ever. And no matter what you order, their portion sizes are huge!    Don't feel bad about being too full for dessert.. they'll still bring you a little sopapilla with strawberry sauce & whipped cream with your check! It's the perfect little ending to a fantastic meal!

SHwksQMZ1QEdlxqDLvYnAQ.text: Food was so-so but I have had much better Mexican food elsewhere.  The place definitely needs to be rennovated and enlarged.

w1KXB3tgRYbUd86LAk6dBQ.text: Only Mexican Restaurant in town. Pico is legit, got to get the Guac, mariachi bands on Friday!

OvRmIYl2NfQnsBS4PujjUw.text: Love this place. Go there weekly with a buddy of mine. Great food with a fun environment too. The amount of food you get is well worth the few bucks it costs. Just don't touch the hot plates.

c28dnAn7x9p7EvXYGWmAeg.text: Charlotte, NC seems to have a problem (at least in my part of town) with Mexican restaurants that have decided to go upscale and charge you too much for the simple dishes we all know and love.  Azteca hasn't gone this route at all.  In fact its basically in the lobby of a Days Inn.  Thank you for protecting what Mexican food really is Azteca.

EdAJgoJ2h1IBGIjJUn1u4Q.text: I've never had a bad meal here. I love Mexican food, but I'm such a picky eater it's kind of difficult to choose something. The servers here are bilingual and some of them struggle a little with English, but they're always polite if they don't understand. They always manage to get my food right, also. The wait on all aspects of service are a little long, no matter if it's busy or slow.

PV9VZn_HmUpizV21_JZF_A.text: Thought I would give this place a try. Went on a Monday night not crowded at all. When we sat down the waiter was quick with the salsa and some type of slaw. Had the table side guac made and it was excellent. The food came out quick and was very hot and good. I will be back.

2FVI2KW8zSFMs4IzHwE4aw.text: My husband and I just moved to Charlotte from Ohio and we have been on the hunt for a good mexican place. Needless to say we are still on the hunt. You would think the closer you get to Mexico the better the food, but that is not the case.  When we got to the place, there was a long line so we thought we were going to have to wait but we got right in. There was a live band playing music which was very nice and set the mood. The service was very prompt and polite.  The chips were just standard chips but the salsa was what I called onion soup with no flavor or heat, and they also served us with what looked like coleslaw. YUCK! I have been noticing that all the mexican places we go to have very soupy and or watery salsa which makes me very sad. My husband and I just got back from Cozumel and it was the most flavorful and thickest salsa you could ever have!  I ordered small combination number one (Hard taco and enchilada) and it was inedible! The taco shell was soggy, I had the server bring me a new shell but that didn't help. The beef in both the taco and the enchilada was a low grade beef like taco bell but with no seasoning (Must be the lack of dairy farms in the area). The enchilada tasted like a soggy diaper! I couldn't bring myself to even eat it. The rice was dry and tasteless and both the beans and the enchilada came with some sort of yellow cheese on top... that tasted awful. The beans were also watery underneath all the yellow cheese.  My husband got the chicken fajitas and we shared it. He seems to like all the food but he was a little tipsy from the very strong margarita. I thought the fajitas were just okay, the onion in them tasted like a sweet onion which i do not fancy. I ended up asking for more salsa because I was still hungry!  However at the end they brought some sort or sweet tortilla dessert. I thought that was a nice added touch but not enough to make me want to ever go back.  We paid 33.00 for 2 people and one margarita, so it was pricey. Either way the hunt is still on for a good mexican place in the Carolina's.

b5pY7b7IdDjRQ1xCcuktjg.text: Here in Charlotte from out of town. Just had an awesome lunch. Great drinks, guacamole at the table was made to order. The fish tacos were awesome and my wife had shredded beef tacos, the beef was very tasty.  The pico de gallo at the table was the best.

QwagFfdaNi8IUrvsErHdCw.text: Went there a couple weeks ago for a business lunch and am catching-up on my reviews. I have eaten at this location many times and have never had a bad meal. It seems like the portions have gotten smaller though. It is always jammed for lunch but usually you are seated quickly.  The food is good and I especially like the pica de gallo (salsa).  The fact that they have been in business for so many years shows that they know what they are doing.  The prices are very reasonable.

V2fno3DMkrj_bgdYSzLh1Q.text: Ever since moving from Texas to Charlotte area, I have been trying to find The Tex-Mex food that i'm familiar with and have been disappointed over and over again here.  But someone recommended Azteca to us and I was not disappointed.  The food, while not outstanding, was much much better than other Mexican restaurants here and I especially liked how they prepared the guacamole table side.  Came at lunch time and found two very large groups (20 at each table) so expected to wait for food and drinks.  To my surprise service was prompt and food tasted fresh.  I'll definitely be back.

aMFRRIf8diJ6o_13CCuhcQ.text: I have had to revise my previous 5 star rating for Azteca because of the LACK OF SERVICE.   The past couple of times we've been here for lunch, I've noticed the server barely comes back to see if you need a drink refill or anything else.  Today after he brought our food, he never came back again (and yes I wanted more tea!) until lhe saw the plates stacked at the end of the table and he asked us if we wanted to order anything else. The .50 tip I left reflected the level of service.  Also, as some other reviewers said, the salsa was very watery and the pork was fatty. Not the Azteca of a couple of years ago.  I'll go back because it's close to work and the taste of the food is good, but the service is lousy.

332vxWud0jL_vL59C7OMAQ.text: Good solid Mexican food, very similar to the style in Texas.  A tad bland for my family but we are more used to California/Baja style.  A nice surprise to find this good of Mexican in NC, good atmosphere and price is right as well.  Had "Super Nachos", also tried "chile rellanos", "tamales" and "enchiladas".  Overall a good dining experience.

H2rSewve8xfv2fJNFjQZKA.text: During lunchtime. Very good. Chicken soup some of the best I have ever had. The pico great also.

2edXGdCToZycy6wj00JzxQ.text: Love this place!  The cabbage salsa they serve with regular salsa and chips is delicious.  Great variety on the menu.

MnwQBEJQCGxAfiD8XoJ1xw.text: When I'm thinking of going to a Mexican restaurant I never think of Azteca, but my friends always seem to love it there.  I can't say I have never had anything there that I didn't like, the food really isn't bad, its just not amazing by any means.  The service can be hit or miss, but they area always friendly.  The place is rather small, and connected to a Days Inn Hotel.  The prices are also not bad.  I have never had a Margarita there so I can't review that.  So for me its a place I would never turn down if suggested, but I just would never suggest it myself....lol.

TF_TCp6JC6HAqc_XcQDQkg.text: Really enjoyed this place.  Traditional mexican menu.  The highlight was definitely the guacamole which was made fresh and to our taste right in front of us.  The tacos and quesadillas were good, but a bit soggy.  Service was great.  Would definitely recommend stopping by just for the guac.

JOZ1DyedWkCEOw6ORww9Gg.text: If you desire real Mexican food this is where it is at! Especially the location on Woodlawn. Great traditional dishes as well as the tex/mex so many Americans enjoy. The salsa is unique and you get a free small desert at the end of every meal.

jFtf5j2ajip_piVG47iWJg.text: Azteca...sure....why not. I rolled in here on a Saturday afternoon while I was running some errands in the neighborhood. My craving for Mexican was taking over and Yelp led me here.   Hubs and I were politely greeted and seated in a big 'ole comfy booth. The surroundings are reminiscent of a Chi-Chi's if you've ever had the unfortunate experience of visiting one. Mexican inspired and, well, Aztec-y. The chips were toasty and tasty but the salsa left me a bit sad. No chunks present - just watery blah. But no matter, the guacamole guy came rolling down the aisle and offered us some green magic. We asked for spicy guacamole and it was indeed full of heat...and flavor! My only gripe? For one avocado, the guac price was $7.95...that's steep IMO.   Onto the entrees...I ordered the enchilada & tamale combo. This option came out on a massive, shallow plate. MASSIVE and covered in sauce and or cheese. Hmph. I *think* the enchilada flavors could have been nice but the cheese dumbed down most of it. The enchilada far superseded the tamale - which was super, duper bland and cakey. The refried beans and rice were standard and nothing to write home about. Meh.  While the service was friendly and efficient, the meal also ended on a sweet note with those crispy cinammon bites with a dab of whipped cream and strawberry sauce. Free little chips of wonder - I could have easily eaten five of them in a snap. Will I head back to Azteca? Perhaps, if I'm in the neighborhood and positively craving Mexican...but I'm not rushing back here anytime soon.

BUns4cGIT1C-OdiXhyx9QQ.text: I love mexican food and I like Azteca restaurant around charlotte so we picked this spot since we were having a surprised B'day party for a friend who lives near by. The staff was courtious enough to work with us on the suprise B'day party. We were constantly going back and forth from our table to front door to see and make sure if they arrived or not so that we can supprise them and they didn't mind at all.   We were total of 16 folks all together and they took really good care of us. Even after the supprise, they brought drinks on time, the food were ordered and it came in resonable amont of time considering we were big group.   Even in between the supprise, apatizer and full dish items, we were hanging out like it was our place. No one bothered us and staff was very helpful in filling in our refills.   All in all we had a plesent experience at this location.

s8xvTm9ySreUNkNEjzJD-w.text: I'm trying to think of anything I dislike about this place and I cant.  The guacamole the woman with the cart makes is great, the queso dip is great, all the food I've had is great.  My personal favorite is the "Dos Amigos" chicken and shrimp in a sour cream sauce oh my god and if you want to get the real deal ask for the handmade corn tortillas.  If I could eat here every day I probably would, and then I wouldnt fit through the door.  Also, I came here on my birthday and they brought me ice cream and sang me happy birthday while banging on drums.  Way better than red lobster.

mTO_uLV_4oIARsjs3zsFxw.text: I stopped here on the way to the airport. It's connected to a Days Inn so I had to question how good it was going to be. But given the clientele I would say the food is authentic. The menu offers lots of choices and the beer and ritas are good. So why the three stars? The service sucked. I was there with a relative who lives in Charlotte and we ordered light (me nachos and she the tres Leche cake, both good) and we were basically ignored for the entire time we were there. The food took so long to come out that we both joked about it. But honestly I was pissed about how long it took to get two simple dishes to our table and about how little attention we were paid. So, food good, drinks also good, service sucked.

OYgmFNyqPebt3ECMWjkefQ.text: Loved this Mexican restaurant! Great food, ambiance and drinks! I'd go back here anytime!

RuiyCFevi_sk2uPWYxe4Kw.text: When I think of good Mexican food in Charlotte, this is the first place that pops into my mind. I would've never thought to go to this place since it's randomly attached to the Days Inn but I went here on a whim a couple of years back and have been going ever since. They have fresh salsa along with warm, crisp tortilla chips and have a guac dude rolling around to each table if you so choose to indulge. Their portions are the size of a baby and they offer margaritas in different fruity flavors that are quite strong. I've tried different combos and like I said before, with portions the size of a baby, I often have leftovers. The nachos were amazing as well and were the size of a toddler and cheaper than my margarita (I found this very amusing) I've found service to better in the bar area when I go and you can't beat dining with Telemundo and ESPN in the background! They also give you free little cinnamon crispers topped with whipped cream after your meal. Yay for anything covered in whipped cream! Anytime I've gone there, the service and food are consistent which is a big plus in my world.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

eL2P2sFA1xwuLm8rBK-JLA.text: I love this place! We frequent a lot as it is close to my work. Sometimes there is a short wait but they are always about to accommodate us. They have great lunch specials and you can get a lot of food for under 10$.

_nGXXxH79kJFHJ_rPrUiWw.text: I wanted to like Azteca because I have always heard such good things from other people, but it just didn't do it for me and I honestly couldn't wait to get out of there.  Went for dinner on Saturday night, got there early and were sat right away.  The chips and salsa were good.  I ordered a Paloma, which was tequila and grapefruit juice and more, but I don't think its what I received.  I could have sent it back but it tasted fine, so I drank it.  We had some queso to start, that was also good.  For entree I got the camarones mexicanos, basically shrimp with onions, mushrooms, green peppers, in a tomato sauce with rice and cheese.  First shrimp tasted very fishy, the rest were better.  But the dish had a sourness to it, the mushrooms were the worst offenders and I couldn't figure out why so I stopped eating them.  So the food overall was fine but the restaurant kind of skeeved me.  There was water underneat my feet so that bugged me, then one of my friends touched some gum stuck under the table and at that point I was done.  I mean I know we're at a restaurant at a Days Inn but come on!!  Finally our server was just not very good or friendly and I sat with an empty water glass for a while.  So I gave it a shot but I doubt I'll be back.

vjJEjqPbtTVarNSjg8_KcQ.text: Holy YUMM! Above and beyond goodness. Fresh guac made to order, in font of my face. Even a little dessert fried goodness with the check.

ju0Axh4OlO-hgO6GfzMsmA.text: Best Mexican food in Charlotte! But the staff that greets you can be kinda rude. Prices are fair.

5oISye1W5OOiZRVNFiC76w.text: Having been to most of the area Azteca's this one ranks lowest.   First strike is being attached to a shady Days Inn. Other than that once you get in the door, its typical Mexican chain restaurant fair inside. Everything, and I mean everything my wife and I ordered came covered in greasy cheddar cheese. Not even a real Mexican cheese, but grocery store pre-shredded cheese.  Our server was very attentive, even took his lunch break at the next table over so he could keep his eye on us. Even though someone else has "covered" his break they both ended up serving us. So great service.  Food quality at other Aztecas just seems higher, and cleaner.

J-reGBN3iv9HMFl8BPHL3w.text: Although I gave four stars, I did see a cockroach crawling on the wall in our booth. Other then that this is my absolute favorite place to get Mexican food. I guess a roach is expected, really gives that authentic feel.

kH5R64L3S66jPsMAo6_vEA.text: We are there on a busy Sat night but were seated promptly. Service was excellent and food was out fast. Have to say everything was very good and was kicking my butt for having gotten an appetizer at the bar before going to the restaurant. Will definitely be on our go to list when back in town.

P3b0Q9FdM9cOeqAkCEKaqA.text: Something hilarious about this Azteca outpost being attached to a slightly retro Day's Inn. Love the weird, ad hoc additions to the architecture - thatched roof beverage station awkwardly built into a corner, odd wood and glass entry hallway made more cramped by the quarter-for-a-bronco-ride thingy.   Everything here is slightly more compressed than the Matthews location - booths narrower, tables closer. Service more harried because they do a LOT more business here - even at a slightly off time for dinner, the place was hoppin'.   I could be imagining things, but I feel like prices were 50 cents higher than the other location, hmm. Servings were a tad smaller, for sure, but you don't need to finish that arm-sized burrito, anyway.   Onto the food: I got the Macho Burrito, he got the usual (fajitas). Now, I've had the Macho at Don Pedro, the other Azteca location, and here - it's a nopales burrito, so it's full of pickled cactus. This was by far the best version I'd had - because the jalapenos were fresh, so it wasn't almost too salty to eat (which, admittedly, has never stopped me from ordering it before). Goooood. A mild, almost mozzarella queso was used instead of the monterey jack I'm used to, continuing the low-sodium thing (except for the nopales). Awesome.  Fajitas were, well, Azteca Fajitas - smothered in sweet teriyaki-style flavors. Weird.  I'd come back if I were in the nabe and had a serious burrito craving, but I'd probably be thinking about the taco trucks and taquerias down the street the whole time.

H-7mNm4aWmH4aQK6_gHVaQ.text: Summary: Excellent food!!! The guacamole was made right there at the table. The service was wonderful. The Marriott cheese band was great. I would go again.  My family and I were traveling through North Carolina. We decided to stop and have dinner at a Mexican restaurant. This one popped up on yelp it looked like a good place to go so we tried it out.  We shared the tres alteca and a Texas fajitas. The food arrived hot and fast. It was way more than three people should eat, but we tried. It was excellent. For new people going I would definitely recommend the homemade guacamole and tres alteca.

JOK-CNT6Ab2O_SgLLOf2Xg.text: I go here pretty often, once a week or so. I have never had a bad experience. I always take friends here from out of town and everyone loves it. If you go late at night the guacamole man will dance on the table!   Pros: awesome service. great prices.

aNQib90PL5n6aoNNnVJdnA.text: Great atmosphere and awesome True Mexican eatery! It's tucked away in front of an old motel and doesn't look like much from the outside but do not let that fool you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. OMG! Love the pitchers of margaritas! Full of flavor!!

nUnufKEwPx7SVFWwonJG8g.text: They are crooks & bamboozled me for a meal that I did not even enjoy! Beware of their pricing and I will never eat there again!

MPG-59GHUYNUujNOG7SlRA.text: Damn good food!   I love Mexican and its a hidden treasure.   Note you can get hot sauces to go.  Bring empty jars and get their green sauce its like fire.  La mejor comida mehicana en el sur este!!

DUwE0mQJLh8ALGE6tfJfEg.text: In town for work, so by myself and got it to go. Asked for a suggestion and was not directed to the most expensive thing on the menu. The staff was very friendly and joked with me while I waited. The food came out fast and hot. I ordered the sopa de tortilla, Arroz Con Pollo (extra spicy) and frijoles negro. The portions are very good and the taste was excellent. I will definitely be back!!

8MxMFCECYA0bKgzu5hGDjw.text: This place is great!  Amazing  top shelf Margaritas use the Luna Lazul  Tequila instead of 1800.

e4MpFu3vGz2lpcIDHejs0Q.text: Guac is always a good idea, especially if it is made fresh next to your table. There is a small and a large option. The small is one avocado and was great for two people to share. We asked for everything, which from what I could quickly see was tomatoes, onions, parsley and jalapenos and the juiciest lime you could ever squeeze. She made it so fast and I loved that she let me try it after she was done. It was good the first time but I ended up adding more jalapenos because I was feeling for something spicy. PRO TIP: She travels with a tip jar on her cart and so have some dollars handy for her personal attention.   Carne Asada was the entree of choice. The meat was tender and portion was huge. It included beans, rice, pico and your choice of flour or corn tortillas. I also got a mango margarita, the mango mix was a little heavy but I knew it was to cover up the tequila and I'm never mad at a heavy pour. The food was very satisfying. The service was great despite being almost completely packed for Sunday Lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango Margarita
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

35BasUgbi-tzfYrVVD_Ilg.text: Great place. Good prices. Wonderful service. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was that I thought there rice could be better.

M9_0gGGpeYchbjwH9G3P_g.text: I always feel like I'm on vacation when I'm here! Such a fun atmosphere and great food!

1Kt-_zxkRa9eB8WGHgA51w.text: The food was pretty terrible. The waiter's head almost exploded when we tried to order things like a quesadilla or taco salad with no meat, he couldn't understand that we didn't want meat. No one at the table finished their food, the margarita was also terrible. I saw a waiter in the kitchen wipe his nose with the back of his hand as he was preparing a dish for someone then brought it out to them.

B0SmfQ6XEHX4nQdRFtlpYA.text: Waiter asked if I wanted ketchup and mustard with my taco... that's all I have to say.

Mtbk_pY63Zv3o8-FQ1k5mA.text: Feels like home.. no, not Mexico! California!  Very authentic Mexican style food. Love the salsa and the tableside guac. My enchilada suizas plate was HUGE. Really tasty and the people who work there are so sweet.  It's connected to a Days Inn - so can look kinda shady, but its definitely a family place you can go for a huge margarita and some yummy Mexican food.

1flG03C9RRZrWocCe2dTmg.text: Five years later, still good. Azteca has all the stuff you would want in a Mexican restaurant - Telemundo on the television, burritos and tacos, rice and beans, imported beers from south of the border, chips and salsa, and a wait staff that understands enough English to bring you a carne asada with flour tortillas.  Food is good. Chips are good. Salsa is good. It's A-OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

8gJK9VyV8nMB4sNPApXOrw.text: The food is good- typical Mexican food- nothing special. Service should be improved. The waiters do not speak English. I was brought the wrong dish and overcharged for it. The manager refused to correct the mistake as it was my fault because "the waiter did not understand me".   We also weren't given the sweet treat at the end of our meal like the other tables were. We didn't bother asking since our waiter probably wouldn't understand us anyway.

jxFHYFSsTpK9LEHJ_ZcBUg.text: Azteca is a down home sort of Mexican restaurant and I'm sure lots of people enjoy it but it's not for me.  The place has a lot of charm with the decor and authentic sounding menu items (I have no knowledge of Mexican cuisine). However the booths are spaced way too closely and you end up banging knees with your dining companion if you sit across from each other. I'm all for a good banging but not in the knees thank you very much.  You get some chips and weird salad thing as well as extremely watery salsa to start off your meal while you decide on what you want. It's kind of nice but the salsa is mostly water so it just slides right off the chip. The food comes out blazingly fast though which is a great bonus if you are hungry and don't want to eat tomato water and chips. Almost everything comes with a salad of wilted iceberg that you can totally skip over, rice and refried beans. The beans and rice are really too salty to eat much of on their own though they were okay with what I ordered which was some sort of well cooked sirloin. Portions are huge, but I was still hungry afterwards because I did not eat most of it.  I was in such a rush to leave that I actually forgot my credit card here and had to return the next day to pick it up. I do not think I will return however if you like this sort of thing go for it.

9e-_FRWoIzmnBDMCnbOgqQ.text: The salsa was like water..very liquidy. I was already not thrilled with the food, but then got very sick as soon as I got home and was vomiting all night. Will definitely not be back.

TnFjh60r39UfQ5xh38a-Bw.text: Not too happy with this restaurant. The portions are big but they give you more fat juice than meat. I ordered the chicken with sour cream which comes with green peppers, I did get a wholleeee bumch of peppers but not really any chicken, it was greasy and not really what I've had before with other Mexican restaurants. My wife's dish was good though, she had the chicken fajitas

lhhLy4yqe4m5oPxIhPaqCQ.text: I'm traveling through Charlotte for business from Houston. I'm a big lover of all things Mexican.  Let me start by saying that the staff here are fun.  I love authentic places and this place had a lot going on.  I sat at the bar and ordered margaritas that were amazing.  I would rather go for an independent place rather than a chain and I'm so glad that I did!!! I love this place. Tacos on point. Authentic.   If you are in Charlotte especially traveling stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wonderful staff

eGwGtgKTh9nFnph5inQKDw.text: Just great Mexican food with out all of the high class fluff that has permeated the  genre. I try something different every time and recommend it all. The food is delicious and served piping hot. The entire staff is super friendly and attentive. I don't know if it's every night or just weekends, but they have a live mariachi band that is really good. So bring a few dollars to tip them and request a song.

NYHmsRJVDn1imvn_iUzsFg.text: Decent mix of authentic and Tex mex on the menu, in a place attached to a rather sketchy Days Inn. I ordered a Pacifico (on tap, no less!) and the chili verde with some corn tortillas on the side.   Meanwhile I occupied myself with the chips and salsa. Chips were okay, a little thick and not eatm, but not bad. The first two rounds are free. The salsa (red) came in a small shallow bowl, so difficult to dip. The flavor was mediocre. I asked for something spicier so they brought me their tomatillo salsa which (.first time I'd seen it) had chilis de Arbol in it. Spicy, but good.  Then the chili verde arrived, accompanied by refritos and rice. The rice was a little dry and bland; the beans were delicious!!!! A little too good as I ate more than I intended. The chili verde was okay, maybe a slightly different style than I've ever tasted. The pork was tender and served generously; the verde sauce didn't reflect the tartness of tomatillo very much and really had a stronger oregano flavor than I've tasted in other preparations.   Service was prompt and very friendly and the meal with beer and tip was less than twenty bucks. Worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili verde dinner
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

JCc_W9-HEIG2gtw2EYprTQ.text: Big portions and nice staff, but the food wasn't as good as I expected :( but Im from San Diego where Mexican food is highly rated :)

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

IQUn6lTsDDAHtg3cbmLwBA.text: The fajitas were good, the portions are huge you can definitely share a meal!! My kids had the burritos they said they liked them  our waiter was very friendly the decor was original and some of the employees had on special cultural uniforms. Theirs a lady that brings a cart if you order guacamole and prepares it in front of your table we enjoyed that. Prices are very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids burrito
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken shrimp and steak fajitas

jUU38e0CigOFvCagTl0NhA.text: 1st off, this restaurant is located literally connected to a Days Inn. Yes, it's somewhat connected to hotel. Due to the location, parking sucks. But atleast you can walk off the extra calories. Decor is traditional. Bathroom is way to small for the amount of people inside.   Service was good. The only complaint I have is that you have to pay at the register at the hostess area. It just leads to a huge cluster of people up front if it's busy so you have to awkwardly stand around and be maneuvered around for those that need to be seated.   Food was delicious. I got the Quesadilla with chicken, rice and beans. It was really good and was the perfect size. They have lunch specials too and servers are available to answer questions.

P0BZ7PMbfnlS2mh2q94GoA.text: Not the nicest outdoor appearance - but don't let that stop you from visiting. Steak fajitas are delicious!! Staff is friendly and service has always been good. One of my favorite authentic Mexican restaurants in Charlotte.

Cu1C3nkV_U-icOsYDSGbIg.text: When I entered the location I wasn't greeted and just stood there for a minute before I walked to the bar. While at the bar still didn't get waited on. After 10 min a gentleman asked if I needed help and the rest of the meal was great which is why I'm giving them 4 stars. The food was amazing and not to pricey at all.

KTWhWTvNTncnHIQor3O53g.text: This Mexican food is absolutely AMAZING. I had to scoop up my brains off the floor and put them in a doggie bag because my mind was blown. My assumption is there is an underground grow room with avocado trees as the table side magician making the guacamole has the freshest avocados ever to be grown. Post guacamole heaven we moved on to the entrees. I honestly don't even know how to put this into words. I ordered the deluxe burrito with rice and refried beans. "Deluxe" is the biggest understatement I've ever heard. This is the mac daddy Mercedes Benz shut your freaking mouth and say "ah" burrito. Chicken beans rice tortilla salsa sour cream guac tomatoes lettuce all checks across the board. Lastly let me say the house margarita with salt on the rim is like Jose Cuervos gift to man to enjoy with a meal suitable for the last supper. Azteca, I love you, and I will see you again soon.

B1n8rsg49bf1OIswsaFchA.text: We needed somewhere to go around 9pm for dinner. We have been wanting to try this place out for a while and it's always busy. We were seated immediately and our waitress was incredibly sweet. The service was fast, the food was tasty, and the portions were huge. The menu is endless and there is something for everyone! Definitely going here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

H75vfM1XyYS4gmvPxUFjTg.text: Great place to eat when you are in the mood for mexican food in Charlotte. Here's why it's a 5 star in my book:  1. Service AND Friendliness: Always great and consistant. I've been coming here over the last 2 years and the service is always quick to please and friendly.  2. Food: The quality, quantity and variety of food they offer is wonderful. I've brought many people here from work over the last 2 years and not one person has had an "average" meal for lunch or dinner.   Their guacamole, super nachos, cheese dip, table salsa and chips, their beef, chicken and picadillo (my favorite) as well as the other things we've had on the menu..... it's simply very good to great food and the portions and prices are great.   Bottom line is that its a great place to eat at for lunch or dinner.

L24KpKjACWAlc2YJouh5Dw.text: try the Veggie stuff. Bean paste and hot cheese always make it double special! try the mango margarita please. you have that drink, do not need another one.

nar_6EJgLTOxY9rqsTrnaQ.text: My go to lunch spot if I'm meeting people out. Big fan of the chicken fajitas. You really can't beat fajitas for $8, and they're good! The service is always great and the food comes out quickly. Never been there for dinner but it's always super busy when I drive by!

6PbFaUDV4SPVPUULvtmLug.text: Great Mexican food with very large portions! I have never seen so much food in my life! The fresh guacamole made table side was delicious. They also had some different things that you don't normally see at Mexican restaurants such as a salsa/pico slaw with the chips and salsa and also a slaw with the combination plates. They also have a free cinnamon tortilla chip with whipped cream and strawberry at the end! I would definitely return!

rZzQLHCeK6jvcR6cTmW8Qg.text: First time and I can tell this place is very authentic. We got the cheesy bean dip and it was to die for! Shredded beef enchiladas were amazing! We will be back soon! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shredded beef enchiladas with rice and beans

uJS0xjjkvxgXV5PDTIQdTg.text: Slow to get seated, hostess was busy playing on her phone, didn't even know I was standing in front of her. Wait staff sat me. Wait staff is fairly attentive. 5 waiters, 23 guests. Salsa was average, chips are bulk ordered.  Ordered chicken quesadilla (fajita quesadilla-chicken). 20 minutes and still no food...  food arrived after a 25 minute wait, cmon man, it's Mexican food.  Food was good though. Pedro and Alex are awesome!

SqN0Emni-1RcTYwden661A.text: The food was okay, but I sat at the bar and my service was terrible. I had to ask for chips and salsa 3 times. I got my food before my chips. I asked them to make fajitas spicy and for some reason it was sweet? WTF? I asked for hot sauce and did not get it, until a waiter that was cashing out noticed and brought it to me. I tipped that waiter that who was nice enough to take care of me 5 times more than my actual waiter.

GYxIccv_cg43EbyGafjqww.text: Friendly staff. Food portions are huge. Wide variety of menu options! The pitchers of margaritas is definitely for more than two people. Highly recommend this local establishment. Will definitely come back here the next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Don Juan

3iZ3VKp_lY7o3j-A_g4i8Q.text: Best shredded beef and fajitas i have found. Great atmosphere, fabulous service and i always leave happy.

cqYOuxcmyih2rMZrdfrOQQ.text: Azteca, what happened?  You were always an option for decent Mexican food but today's visit you were quite below average.  The service was good as it usually is here but my combination of chicken enchilada and beef taco had absolutely no flavor.  Couple that with the usual flavorless beans and rice and it was quite bland.  How could this happen at a once decent Mexican place.  Did you take lessons from Tres Pesos across the street?  Meh, I am sorry to say that I will not be returning here.

FWhuw0kNi8Fvr7z_xbIrdg.text: Absolutely amazing every time we come here for dinner. The service is too notch and the food is on point. We always get the table side guacamole - it's a must!!

ooxGgYUXhK1Kb5oik5mTMA.text: Solid authentic Mexican food with an interesting vibe. Not sure if I'd take out of town guests here since it's in a Days Inn, but overall has great service and food is priced well.

gVCfTJ8luQOAGJCQkjKbww.text: We had a group of 10 in town for an event on Friday night. Found this place for dinner on Thursay and everybody was glad we did! First it is the real deal, the staff could not have been better. Everyone's meal came out together and was great. Did I mention that it was a terrific value because it sure was. If you have the opportunity to stop in do it.

7nmmIHTgqAKtWVTTjbWCFA.text: Azteca is suprisingly a great place to take a huge group for lunch.  They're speedy, you can call ahead and reserve a giant table, and they don't complain too much about haveing 20 seperate checks.  I normally order something small off the lunch menu, because I inevitably fill myself up with chips and salsa before my lunch even comes.  I always save room for the desert at the end!  Pro tip: if you're trying to get out of Azteca to head towards Billy Graham, go out the back of the parking lot to come out at the light.  Making a left onto Woodlawn is just plain crazy.

6sBtSyXW-H8WtIg-xG90NA.text: This place is a gem. It's great food and great service. Alex has been such a wonderful waiter and made our experience a pleasure each time.

1staK2VA_avh1dDzo4CLnQ.text: I'm giving this 2 starts because of the terrible service. We have not had a refill on our drinks in over 15 minutes, waited for extra chips and still didn't receive our extra sour cream that we will probably be paying for on the bill. Not to mention while we're getting terrible service the servers are all gathering around chit-chatting. Don't sit at any of the booths by the bar.   The food is great, guacamole is 5 stars, sweet tea is another good perk, wish I could have enjoyed this place and given credit to the food.   UPDATE: went back and had the same person as our waiter lmao go figure. The food is amazing and the margarita's are strong. Our waiter definitely did better this time and didn't forget about us.

XR2cb_jXn6kNQrLa5nr57A.text: I was meeting my date in the North Lake area, and my friend recommended Azteca in the past, so we decided to check it out!  I got there before he did, so I grabbed a table and ordered a Dos Equis Amber, my favorite, and it was on special!  They brought me chips and salsa to munch on, which were good.  I asked if they had anything spicier- and my server, who was very attentive, sent over one sauce- checked in with me, then sent an even spicier salsa once he realized I could handle it.  I'm all about hot sauces and salsas, and they were both great!  The hotter of the two was pretty crazy I have to admit.  Anyways, my date arrived and we ordered a little later.  He ordered a burrito, which he enjoyed.  I got the mixed fajitas- my usual at a mexican restaurant- and they were decent.  Portion was good for the price- I believe it was around $12.  The shrimp were kinda small, compared to my favorite spot, Three Amigos, in Plaza Midwood.  It's a big restaurant!  If you have a big group, it would be perfect!  Very attentive service, and I loved the tortilla treat at the end.  Who doesn't like honey and whipped cream?!?  Yum.  I'll hit it up again if I'm in the area!

-AIt7r4kxVqFxIL-7Y8j4w.text: Food was simply amazing! Our waitress was sweet, polite and quick. We watched as tortillas were made fresh in front of us. I recommend eating here!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Camerones Mexicanos, so yummy!

KLkGqSOENzaUiIYU2BT7zQ.text: Okay when I kept reading massive portions, I was still surprised. Pictures do not do it justice!! Check my photo, standard size steak knife, MASSIVE plate.  Excellent service, all the food was really tasty though rice was average at best. The food is plentiful though so you'll get full even if you leave rice!  Shared cheese dip with the table and ordered the carne asada. It can be hit or miss, but not only was Azteca's good, it might be THE best carne asada I've ever eaten at a Mexican restaurant!   If you want good grub, good service and a great value, don't hesitate to eat here. It'll be a staple stop whenever I'm in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne asada
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large combination #24

EgCTKx0cpWSr1KMoOZh72g.text: First time eating at this particular location and I will definitely return. Great wait staff and the food was amazing. For my choice of beverage I got the large pina colada and I should have had 2 but I will be back for more. Location has a small parking lot but has overflow parking towards the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pina Colada...so yummy.

lgoaDXajH4aoPpXtWk_RWg.text: Still on the hunt for great Mexican food in the Charlotte area.  Came here because of the reviews on Yelp and it looked pretty authentic.  Upon arrival, I did have some second thoughts.  Conveniently located near a Days Inn that may or may not offer hourly and monthly rates.  If fact we had to park facing this motel in the back of the restaurant. As we were walking toward the front of the restaurant, a kitchen employee did come out to cut or peel a vegetable over a trash can.  Hmmm... At the hostess station, we were asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside on the patio.  We chose inside because it was still hot outside.  No sooner that we sat down we were greeted with the loud mariachi band.  They are good but they are loud.  And the trumpet is even louder.  Anyways, because the mariachi band is loud, the patrons are even louder.  There was a table of 2 families sitting and the women were literally yelling at each other to tell a story.  It was quite obnoxious.  They had small kids with them who were wandering around the table and when the mariachi band came to their table.. of course one of the mom's stood up on her chair to do a dance.  In all my years of going to restaurants, I have never seen that.  I don't frequent strip clubs but I imagine that's what happens there.   Oh..the food.  The chips were good but the salsa was one step above tomato juice.  I asked for a spicier version and they brought a green salsa that had a little spice.  I ordered the Expresso Burrito which was supposed to be Chile Verde, rice, and beans.  Turned out to be chunks of pork but they were lean and tender.  Overall, decent Mexican food with a not so decent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crinkle Fries!
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tamale and enchilada combo
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Expresso Burrito-chile verde, rice, and beans

98I_hAK1wAFE46z7NyZhjg.text: Waitress order wrong meal for my husband and they would not change it. Waitress sent two over to speak to us and said manager said he had to pay for it regardless. Unprofessional and never heard such thing. Never going back!

QZv4sAEMGhpZTQe04jlmIA.text: Huge portions and great "dirty" Mexican food! Don't let the fact that it's next to a hotel scare you off!   The chips and salsa aren't amazing, but they are free. They also serve their chips with a cilantro coleslaw that I really enjoy.   The deluxe burrito is the size of the baby and I'll give you props if you eat it all. At $9 it's always my go to meal here. It also comes with a side of refried beans and rice.   The fajitas are also great and big enough to split with someone. My husband and I opt for the trio, which has steak, shrimp and chicken. The meat is cooked perfect and it has a great variety of peppers  and onions with it. Very tasty dish! Make sure you ask for extra shells.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deluxe chicken burrito aka the baby you didn&#39;t know you had.

Zg-UpqC79woEbCig-GByfw.text: This place is awesome. The food and service are amazing every single time we go here. The area and location seems bit sketch at first but you won't be disappointed!

kA6oawwCHgah013DtkguEg.text: I can't ever complaint about this place. It has never disappointed me and I have been visiting since I first moved to Charlotte in 2002.   Their Tortilla Soup is excellent. They even serve the broth on a separate pot to keep the tortillas crispy for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. TortillaSoup
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tortilla Soup

nLhDaJYTTKdjZ9OLjFKs_g.text: You've got to eat here! They have a Mariachi Band that plays to you on Friday nights... who doesn't love that? The guacamole is so good and fresh- made right at your table.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Supersized!

aPjGbg6F5R4X8xjyIlb1jQ.text: The chips were the best part about this place!   The rice was terrible. Our meals were not great.   The ladies room was out of order and strangely enough they seemed like they didn't want me to leave. They directed me to a shady bathroom past the servers, the dishwashers and cooks in the back. It was boiling hot back there with all kinds of smells. Yuck!

Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sopapia
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Broccoli, onion, and zucchini - very good

1L-0Wcjyll0zdookWDKr6A.text: I've been to Azteca a few times, but this review is about our most recent visit on a Thursday night. When you pull up, it usually leaves people scratching their head as it is next to a days inn that has seen better days. However, don't be deterred! I've seen other yelpers tag it as "dirty Mexican", which is what my wife and I jokingly call it as well. What you get is a pretty authentic experience with some really simple and delicious Mexican food (think meat, rice, beans, sauce).   We pulled in late (~10 PM) to grab a quick dinner and ended up sitting outside on the patio. They have a decent drink menu to go along with their expansive food menu (also be sure to check out the menu full of photographs for a few kicks) and I ended up getting a 32 oz sugar creek pale ale that was on special - I soon realized my mistake when the massive glass hit the table as I don't do math well (almost 3 beers!) after 10 PM. We ended up splitting a fajitas plate as the portions are huge and even I couldn't finish one myself.   The staff is always super friendly. I had flashbacks to our travels to central america as the waiter's common responses come in Spanish and he tolerated/helped me with my poor broken Spanish. There is a bit of a culture gap here, so you may have to work to get your bill. I ended up closing up at the front due to the late hour and they were closing down.   All in all - a fun place to go and grab a simple but tasty meal!

rXNnpIxXpZAKXT9leUWGDg.text: My experience with the food here is always bleh- the dishes always taste like something is missing. I tried their shrimp n chicken burrito this time. The taste didn't wow me. The sauces are to watered down. Needs more flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

DryT2V2V9oWFRjuxiuCzEQ.text: One of the better Mexican Restaurants in Charlotte . Old school menu with Combo platters and platters. Been there many times over the past few years, I kind of feel like food quality is getting less. I ordered a Chili Rellano and it was burnt but filled with delicious cheese and Mexican Crema. Guacamole is good but expensive because they make it tableside . Chips are just meh. Waiters and Waitresses are very nice. You won't be overwhelmed with compliments when you go but it's not terrible .

NYsGiT-khKojZ-0z44SMVQ.text: Absolute worst Mexican food I've ever had.  Carnitas burrito, the carnitas.. so bland and looked boiled.  The burrito itself was covered in some red sauce that reminded me of canned kids pasta sauce.  The sprinkling of shredded cheddar on top really put me off as well.    The salsa for the chips was the same red sauce with some onions and cilantro.  Flavorless, worthless.  This place sucks

J9uwFacQunwPjxjjbCIhjg.text: This is my 2nd time I been here. I feel like if you're looking for authentic Mexican than this is the place. At one point in the past, they have a station in the restaurant in the front that they make tortillas from scratch. But since they gotten soo popular and demand is high that it's impossible to make it from scratch up front.   I ordered the shrimp fajitas with corn tortillas. I really really like it.. The green and red peppers with the onions were perfect. The shrimps was not overcooked and plenty of it.. Corn tortillas came warm.. My company ordered chicken fajitas and 3 beef hard shell tacos. They finished their meal and smiling so I'm assuming it must be good. We were starving so there wasn't much talking at all.   The gentleman that was waiter did his job. Did his thing! I wouldn't say he was on top of thing but he manage.. But he wasn't bad either!!   Overall I would love to go back and try a few more things on the menu. But knowing me, I'll get the shrimp fajitas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mojitos
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp fajitas! Very yummy

M-XtmshfS23bFkrv6TveiQ.text: I was a little wary about this place. From the outside, it looks super sketch because the restaurant is semi-attached to a Days Inn. It's awkwardly positioned to the right of the hotel. But hey, sometimes that's where you get the most authentic food.  Walking in, that's when I realized, it was very cultured and decked out. I felt like I walked into an Aztecan temple filled with golden chairs/walls/tables, you name it. It may have been the color of the wood and the light that was shining just right. I felt like I needed to offer a human heart in return for my food. But we'll save that for another time ;)  The menu, like any traditional mexican restaurant was expansive. Average price around $7-12, so pretty good. I think there were over 60 items on the menu. I ultimately chose the Avocado Tostada and an enchilada. My friend got 2 tacos and an enchilada. While we were waiting for our food, the chips and salsa came out. Chips were the same as any mexican restaurant, however the salsa came with two different types: a cabbage blend and the regular salsa. The cabbage salsa was unique and sweet. Usually cabbage is bitter but it was rather pleasant. We also ordered some queso to go with the chips.   I would say the only caveat about this place was the service. It was a bit slow and forgetful. We ordered the queso and we didn't receive it until we got our meal (which was 20 minutes after we ordered). Water refill was slow if not at all (we had to hail down our waiter). Let me tell you though, it was alot of queso, so definitely your money's worth. When we got our food, it was served on this gigantic plate (~20 inches wide). The food was spread out, but it was still alot of food. Avocado tostada was a bit disappointing as I only got 2 small chunks of avocado.  Regardless, the experience was amazing. We got sopapillas at the end. It's essentially fried chips with a sprinkle of strawberry drizzle and powdered sugar. Nice way to polish off the lunch. Til next time amigos.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The decor!
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso plus cabbage and salsa dip
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado tostada

Czd41J8N6SrWPPrOgIWSdw.text: It's solid Mexican food with good service. Decent chips. Decent salsa. They even have a slaw like salsa that is tasty.  The actual food portion sizes are smaller than what I think we typically get. But they give you plenty of rice and beans to make up for it. It might just be me but I think their prices are creeping up a little as well.   The best part is the unexpected little treat at the end.

Xw2NsQ-sEv25wcPNAGX90w.text: Delicious food and yuuugggge portions. We went on a whim for lunch on Saturday afternoon after looking up some options for Mexican on Yelp. I found out later that it's a favorite of many of my food-loving friends. There were chips on the table within minutes of sitting down, salsa and coleslaw as well, though I would have liked a bit more salsa in the bowl and it was bland.   My husband ordered the burrito especial and myself the enchiladas suizas (green). My plate was larger than I've ever seen for one person. The enchilada portion was two large and the plate was filled with rice, beans, and slaw. I loved the rice and beans most! The verde sauce was also lacking in flavor, some heat would have been nice. My husband was completely pleased with his meal and is already planning our next visit. He even finished off my plate and left ready for a nap. For about $20 we left full following excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchiladas suizas (verde) with rice and beans. This is seriously one entree.

sdsPxqcbsIz1GvN_FOQnNQ.text: This restaurant was absolutely amazing. I was you're in town for a business trip and came in with a colleague you had it in the past. I was blown away great authentic Mexican food. I highly recommend the pork Carnitas

KiWPtgbEcO7feWD_VjWdlA.text: Pretty good food. Came with my family. Great service. Good parking. Good portions and pricing. Not such a good location. Old and in the cut location. Passed by it for years and never checked it out. Might go back when I'm in the mood for Mexican.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food was ok but the service was excellent.
