Wp23261S3s6HC3FktTtEGw.text: Was highly disappointed by everything. Their salsa was strange, their nachos were not good either. There are far better mexican restaurants to go to besides here.

byCz6-_0DYA6W0Rsfb4FQw.text: Good choice for Mexican food in Charlotte. Enjoyed the flautas as well as the cheese dip. It is one of the best cheese dips I have had at a Mexican restaurant.  Highly recommend.

rNEVZw9DzAdIeCazu8JoOg.text: This is by far the best Mexican food I have ever eaten.  My co-worker turned me onto this place and it has ruined my previous favorite Mexican restaurants as there is no comparison.  It doesn't look like much on the outside, but the food is awesome.  I always get a Number 31 with beef and their beef is seasoned so good.  Love this place!!

_7-z0XhoxB1otSxQcD3UsA.text: Growing up six miles from the Mexican border, I'm convinced "authentic" to me is not what others consider "authentic"!    For being in North Carolina, thousands of miles from the border, this is pretty darn authentic by my standards!    It's a Sunday afternoon and the place is packed with hispanic families!  That's an automatic one star for me!!!  This usually means the food will be more homemade type Mexican food and less commercial like you would get at a Carlos O'Kelley's type place.  Then the guacamole cart comes around and fresh guacamole is made at your table!!  And BAM!  There's three stars!  The guacamole was AMAZING!!!  You get to pick all of the ingredients as well as how spicy you would like it.    Then our orders of chile verde, a heaping ceviche (complete w Tapatio) and a combo plate of an enchilada and avocado tostada comes out just as we finish the guacamole!  Four stars!!!  The food is delicious, the wait staff is helpful and prompt.  Just when we realized we couldn't stuff out faces with one more bite, out came a perfect-sized portion of buenelos type dessert with strawberry sauce FOR FREE!!!!  And before you know it we are at FIVE STARS!    We ate at El Charo in the same area a couple of nights ago and they don't come close to Azteca!!!  So ignore all of the stars El Charo got and go to AZTECA!!!!

sSvF8DAL6cBMwb8wVbc7iQ.text: Never even knew about this place until I started hearing rumblings about this must eat place off Woodlawn.  I love Mexican food, probably my favorite, so I decided to give it a shot.  Meh...what's all the fuss about?  Very typical Mexican food.  Blindfold me, put a plate from Azteca or a place like Monterrey and I promise you I couldn't tell the difference.    That being said....it's good.  I've been here several times and never been disappointed but at the same time, never overly impressed.  In the restaurant business no bad news is probably great news so take that as a compliment Azteca!  Service is quick and polite always.

qN_To3Eoy7GK2XLu7LcoPA.text: Aztecs is typically a decent choice for Mexican food in this part of Charlotte. Waiting 20 minutes when we were told a 15 minute wait. When we went to check on the status they said we were never recorded for a table upon arrival. Promptly left.

bzz57eesOXYTElMDb0fDZQ.text: Been eating here ever since they first opened. Something between 15 and 20 years ago.LOVE it! I'll admit sometimes the cooks might be having a bad day. But we all do. The manager has always stops by to greet me while I'm there. And is always concerned about our meals. He has always made our visits pleasurable, corrected and even replaced an order for us if we didn't like it or if it wasn't done right. Please people before you bash or give a bad review, give a restaurant at least 3 or 4 visits before you bash them. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. The food is amazing

K16v6-RtNHEMhtAeQBRLbA.text: I don't think I would describe this as authentic as much as what Americans expect for a  Mexican restaurant, but it is very 'Fiesta!!!"  in decor, with lots of tile, colors, booths and tables that can be put together for groups and large families.  Chips and sauces/slaw provided.  We've eaten here many times over the years.  Good value.  Portions are huge.  Table side guacamole is good.  Near the airport and a good place to  have a quick meal with friends who have a 2-3 hour layover.

vuaStT06DXl9vMtWjlwvkw.text: We sat at the bar. Service was minimal and not unfriendly but not too welcoming. Fajitas were pretty good. Expresso burrito (pork) was absolutely tasteless. Sauce surrounding it seemed like just thin bland tomato paste. Margarita was fine (giant and super sweet like a lot of other places)

Q6Ij6u6lFY7N8tn6ZtcXAA.text: I have to say that I am pretty disappointed. Service tonight was very slow, and frankly the food was totally unremarkable. I had the Tres Azteca, and while the flavors of the steak and chicken were almost alive, the shrimp was DOA - clearly overly freezer burned and rubbery, and had no discernible flavor. I asked for *HOT* salsa to liven things up, but their offering was, again, fairly flat.  The flavors did not excite me, the service was tepid, the price was reasonable - but I won't be back.

sgT9pLu1EptQPnTU9n4neQ.text: This place was phenomenal. Huge potions, great chips and salsa, and this delicious chip thing that they gave us for dessert. Service was also superb -- there was so much food that we had leftovers, but they didn't bring us a bag, and I was just about so say something when a waitress came over and quietly bagged our boxes for us. Can't wait to go back!

_vXMZpUOsUc-gs_pZhu1qw.text: This place is my absolute favorite! Been going here for years now. Their guacamole is on point, their Deluxe Burrito is the best and they have very good service.

Le2F38ObrT7V9BFRBNqKjg.text: Great service, great food. Get the queso and quac. This place is excellent:) their portions are large but the service is on point too. Affordable date night or bring the kids.

2PxH7luMESB_kVEpx8HDdw.text: I love the food here. I come here often. The dishes are large and there is always some leftover to take home. I always order the Mexican stir fry which is chicken and lots of mixed veggies. My girlfriend always gets different dishes and I eat off her plate. The staff is friendly, the beer is always cold and the music is lively. We always end with fried ice cream. I love love love my fried ice cream.

W21sU5gMnOEXvisKXzPbZA.text: Decent food, but nothing to write home about. Dining room is tight... booths are only fit for thin people and even then it's a tight squeeze. Food is overly greasy, salsa is watery, chips are mediocre and limited. I really do not see what the big deal is about this place... it's decent, but nothing to rave about. The best thing about the place is the fast service. You could do better... you could do worse, but  you owe it to yourself to try some place different if you believe Azteca is "great" or even "above average".

boBcF__ECw8h5TZuEneI_w.text: The food and service are spectacular. I would drive to Latin America to experience it all again. The fajitas were spot on, and the margharitas were enormous and delicious. At least 5 different servers asked if I needed anything and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes for my food. Also free chips and salsa. Will come back next time I am in Charlotte

9rmkp9RD6Cuy4iZiTyp5kw.text: Absolutely great Mexican food! If I am ever back in town in Charlotte, I will definitely go again. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Sq9zG7N94HyZWtuC-KAzmQ.text: I am not a mexican food expert but this place was pretty darn good!  The outside looks kinda sketch and it's attached to a Days Inn which makes is seem somewhat suspect. But once you walk in it's fine.    We walked in and were immediately seated and served delicious chips and salsa (only the first 2 bowls of chips are free as I saw on the menu) not like you need more than that but just sayin...  I had a combo plate of a taco and an a cheese enchilada with rice and beans, it was enormous and only about $7, I also had a giant peach margarita that was delicious.  That cost more than my meal ($8 I think?) but I had a rough day and it was worth every penny.    Consensus - cheap, decent mexican food a short drive from my apartment.  Sold.

QAtr5WRsVKmVCdWIaiIdmQ.text: Guacamole is on point. Service is great, the best I've seen. The food was good.

VcZWLlZYwCcfjtGJO4Jr9Q.text: Meh, I've had better. Went here for lunch the other day and the place was packed. Seated right away and was met by the server instantly with chips. There was a little man walking around with a make shift cart offering tableside guac. A little odd and pricey. $6 for one avocado or $8 for two...hmmm...ok. Not bad for price of tableside guac if the portion matched the price, which it did not.  Ordered the combo place of tostada, enchilada and taco. Came with typical rice and beans. The portion was HUGE! Could barely finish it and had to wait to start it because it was so hot. Hot like it was sitting under the lamp too long. Flavors were just ok.   All in all, decent, though not a place I'll likely return considering all the other good Mexican restaurants around town.

XtZL04-I6h15ejHJ96TUEQ.text: Another Mexican restaurant that doesn't look like anything spectacular from the outside, but the inside doesn't disappoint. I'm starting to think the trend is that the worse looking the outside facade, the better the food & prices are. This Azteca may not have the best Mexican food, but it's pretty good, especially for the price.  Nothing really stands out to me about any of the lunch plates I've gotten, but I just know I leave very full. The place is a tad bit on the smaller side, with some odd booth arrangements, so expect a wait if you go during the lunch hustle & bustle. It can also be a pain getting in & out of the parking lot but it's well worth it.  Azteca is a lot more popular than you'd think from 1st look, but there's a reason people keep going back & waiting for tables during lunch. You'll leave full without hitting the wallet too hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

IILsoN6uh4rjmX0MYeSWZg.text: Great lunch shortly after we landed at Charlotte airport! Fresh tortilla chips and salsa almost immediately appeared at our table when we were seated. The pork carnitas were spectacular and came with a nice variety of fillings to assemble soft tacos with. We also had the shredded beef chimichanga, which was tender and flavorful. The meal was hearty and topped with complimentary dessert of fried tortillas sprinkled with cinnamon sugar, a dollop of whipped cream, and strawberry sauce. Would certainly go back again!

ldbVRJJ9kZTtt_VrWnRjjQ.text: I had the carnitas burrito. Was not expecting it to be in the Day's Inn but it smelled amazing so don't let that throw you off,

BJhvWxy-QwbI6RUKbDlCDQ.text: Awesome food, service and price.  We're from Texas and this is the closest we've ever found to the Tex-Mex food we love.  Try the cheese enchiladas - yummy!!!!

0Q5OW2UcVpDpu7q2S2ImZg.text: The atmosphere is awesome, great decor.   Don't let the little entrance next to the Days Inn fool you.  I wasn't too impressed with the food.  It was just okay.  The salsa is not good - very runny.  But, they do give you a delicious  slaw with the chips.  Prices are really cheap - great lunch specials.

yur2EKSS0ebT1HrGtStG5g.text: This place is sooo good!!!!! And the desert they give you delicious. Second time here and I'm happy. Large portions for cheap

caxvhuan5Xb4j5yFNdBY8Q.text: Love love....love Azteca. Their made to order Guac is the best.       I've eaten here quite a few times throughout the years and have yet to be disappointed. Their Carne Asada is delectable as well as the Arroz con Pollo.      I highly recommend the margaritas too! Azteca is great for large groups because of it's lively atmosphere.

q1lkXBqNkklkD5RxrJ3Z9A.text: This place is very legit. The foods come across very authentic. They have a guacamole cart and come around and make custom guacamole at your table which is awesome! Would recommend.

3bnHl9CRPpVexDfgHo9wug.text: Wow.....GIANT beers and awesome food. Got the 2 Burrito plate with chile verde and chorizo. The rice is fantastic also.

LprlswtgOYfIA8XDQ4UhHQ.text: This place has the best Mexican food ever. Large portions and great chips, salsa, and cheese dip! Really love the service also.

DP80KG1Zje1GOSCtKtjgIg.text: Best mexican restaurant in Charlotte!  Food is out of this world (my favorite is the Carne Asada) and everything is very reasonably priced.

yuXuNsgBX_R7fJnWi6lwLA.text: Azteca is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte!  If you go there you'll see why, tons of charm and the food is amazing!!  Great atmosphere at lunch or dinner time!  They have a tons of cheap lunch specials and you get a ton of food.  Plus, all you can eat chips, salsa and Mexican slaw...Yum!!  One of my favorite dishes they serve is the Carnitas Des Reyes (I think that's how it's spelled!)!  Sliced beef strips in a tomato-ey sauce with green peppers and onions.  Served with your choice of flour or corn tortillas, rice, beans and guacamole.  The beef is so tender and has a ton of flavor.  If you've never tried it before, please do!  If you like fajitas, you would like that dish!  I've also had their fajitas and they are the best around!  I don't think I've had a bad meal there.    Service is always great and fast, especially at lunch time.  Oh, and at the end of your meal you get these wedges of tortillas dusted with sugar and drizzled with honey and strawberry sauce, topped with whipped cream!  One of my favorite desserts ever and you get it with your meal!  Yum!!  Don't let the fact that it's attached to a Days Inn make you not want to go in.  Just keep your focus on the food and atmosphere and you'll forget that the hotel is even there!!

SVtJ_9gx3Z9o1YgcqtIsVQ.text: Unbelievable carnitas and margaritas!!  Highly recommend this place - looks like a dump but don't let that fool you!

Uk1PHtwGweanzD48hIGkdQ.text: I like the feel of this restaurant with nice lightings, buzzing with people and delicious food, though I must admit, the additional parking area shared with days inn looks kinda shady. Was here for dinner with my wife and was greeted with smiling staff, you do have options to sit out and have food but I preferred sitting indoors. The chips and salsa were good, but not anything extra ordinary. The dinner portions of fajitas and one more dish(forgot the name) were more than enough to make you full so be sure if you are bigger groups to not order too much. The taste was good, liked the freshness of the veggies and the chicken was well fried and all items were served hot. The tortillas were hot and were freshly made. This is a must go if you like Mexican food and with so much Mexican families coming to this restaurant, as I could see from the crowd, am pretty sure this is closest to the authentic taste they have in Charlotte. Please try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

emvSHRqWgFRal5zfYCPzrg.text: Hands down the best chicken fajitas I've had in my life, and I'm a Mexican food snob!

6v3J1IcrO1FrWtMZrJ3V0A.text: A "hole in the wall" restaurant with really delicious authentic Mexican food and a wide variety to choose from :) The indoor decor was really beautiful too and the service was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchilada Popeye - vegetarian option that was very delicious!

bRwFKyyim5CX88ul1tFBmg.text: It was 7pm on a Sunday, St. Patricks day, and we were out-of-towners looking for dinner near our hotel in Charlotte.  We were surprised to find that most restaurants were closed.  Azteca was the fourth one that we tried and, finding it open, decided to give it a try.  When we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming.  There was a plate of food on display which looked kind of congealed and gross - it had probably been there the whole day - and made me question whether dinner there was a good idea.  There was no wait for our table.  When we were seated, they promptly brought us delicious chips and salsa.  Our waitress was very kind.  We ordered four different dishes and shared - they were all fabulous.  Large portions for great prices.  There was also a woman walking by with a cart making fresh guacamole on request.  She was adorable and I loved that she made it right in front of us.  Overall, Azteca was not a place I probably would have chosen first but I'm really glad we stumbled upon it.  A great find!

95YtfeBVJvg1rePjIbO8Eg.text: We've lived nearby for a little over 6 months and have only heard great things. We decided to take advantage of the good weather and head over for dinner on the patio. Initially I was concerned the patio would be full since every time we drive by its crowded. Thankfully, it was pretty empty! Lucky us.  First off, the service is pretty poor. They weren't very friendly when we were asking/waiting to be seated. Second, we had to ask several times for more chips since they only put about 10 chips to each basket. The longer we waited, the harder the bowl of queso we ordered got. In the first 30 minutes we waited 15 minutes for more chips and a refill on our drink. We finally got our food and, not surprisingly, the order was wrong. We just sucked it up and didn't say anything since we figured it would take another 30 minutes for them to correct it.  Overall, food is about 4-stars, but the service was at best a 1.5. I'll be generous and give Azteca 2 stars.

GOh5Q5XAuqjG2F2aml5Q7A.text: I took my daughter and her friends to a concert last night in Charlotte.  After I dropped them off I searched Yelp for a Mexican Restaurant in the vicinity and found Azteca.  I was seated immediately in the restaurant and received a menu, my chips and saulsa and my drink order was taken.    I ordered the Pollo Crema and guacamole.  Soon after I received my ice cold draught beer and a waiter came to my table and prepared the guacamole to order using a fresh avacado, onions, tomatoes and celantro. My only disappointment is I ordered a small portion instead of the large.  Moments later the entree was served on a huge dish full of rice and beans with my chicken.  The cream sauce was rich and eating it along with the guacamole was to die for.    The server was exceptional too and he frequently checked to ensure the food was good, my beverage was full and chips were aplenty.  I have eaten Mexican food from coast to coast and this was by far the best I've ever had.

vcChecV-HSfypPpYV4MiHQ.text: The first impression was a good one.  The host led us to our table and I couldn't help but notice the murals of Aztec leaders and ancient designs painted on the walls.  The dining area has a warm and inviting feel.  Festive music can be heard but not too loud.  After being greeted by a waiter in traditional garb they immediately brought us their house chips which are light and crispy and they'll bring as many as you can eat.    The salsa is watery, chunky, lacks any kick and I didn't find the pico de gallo appetizing either.  But the guacamole is made fresh table-side by a charming woman who doesn't speak much but smiles a lot.  You get to choose how spicy and whether you want onions, cilantro, lime, or all of the above.  She then muddles it in a stone serving dish and lets you taste-test it before she sets it on your table and moves on.  The ground beef tacos are too greasy.  But the flank steak in the Tacos al Carbon is sublime compared to the other items I've tried so far.  The menu is huge so there are still plenty of items to try on return visits.  For the value and down home atmosphere it's a great alternative to the other high (snooty) and low (scary) Mexican restaurants around town.

0SuA10OFEGSoYu2KH3Y9ww.text: The guy here - Louis - was rude and racist. He could not serve us vegetarian option when we asked for the menu item without the meat. He said they don't do that. We always get that in most of the mexican restaurant we visited. This guy is a moron and seems like he is fine with us reporting this online when I said so. I would ask everyone not to visit this racist place, who can't even speak good English, I am sure he spits on the food he serves.

Hf9haajh_5DRncrYSW7n5g.text: Fresh food & great drinks with very nice atmosphere. Outstanding service. Definitely order the fresh guacamole prepared table-side. Karaoke Saturdays 9 pm - 2 am are the best!

mv8kpb11GLRc62miwiMabw.text: The food was pretty decent at this place.  The salsa is rather thin, but it has a good flavor.  The cabbage mix here was basically flavorless.  It is much better at other locations.    It was a Friday night and very busy, but we were seated immediately.  The server wasn't very personable or friendly.  He wouldn't spilt items on the bill for us and was overall rude.  He mostly had other people bringing out our food items and refilling drinks.  He also never checked back to see how everything was.    Not a bad experience, I would try again one day if I was in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

cTs3GJOcwBigKx0AV66TcA.text: This place was great! This place was not just great but very pleasant. I was in town for work for a week and I was there 3 nights in a row. The salsa is absolutely fantastic and the service is up to par.  The bartenders were very pleasant, we had very easy going conversations and really got to know them. It can be a little loud but I was able to make it pass that.

9q9fUHfQkbCy90HqDq2B8A.text: We are from San Diego and the food at Azteca reminds us of the Mexican food we get at home. No Tex-Mex here! The plates are huge and the slaw that accompanied the dinner was great. Ask for verde sauce - nice and spicy! We had friendly, quick service.

oW6a2ZzZh3BSN3jMcWrvHw.text: Adorable, inviting authentic Mexican restaurant next to the Days Inn. The chips are from a bag and the salsa is not homemade. Not much flavor to it. I was surprised to see the pre-made margaritas in a jug, but it turned out to be great! Table-side guacamole is a nice touch. Lots of menu items as well as an entire separate menu full of pictures for the indecisive. Live traditional musicians add to the ambiance. I'll be back!

mfRyyNSUeB7j_YAhy7pabA.text: Want some chicken soup to brighten your day?  They got it and you should, too.  Very good and oh, so much chicken.  Azteca has also a wide variety of Mexican food and is more than your average "chicken, rice, and beans" joint.  I think their food is done well.  Best Mexican ever?  No.  That doesn't exist in Charlotte.  About the only thing I dislike is their parking--very crowded (and yes, weird parking at the motel).  Other than that, I say "give 'em a whirl!"

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

KSZOt3JifDROTXe28EBThw.text: The hubs and I went to Azteca for a late lunch after I read some decent yelp reviews. And it was just that... decent.  The interior and decor is pretty neat. We just got back from Mexico, so it was nice to see some authentic art and hear authentic music again. The place was not busy when we went, and initially, service was fast. We got our drinks and chips right away. Then after saying we needed a minute, we got about 10 before someone came to take our order. No one checked on us during the meal.   The food was good, not the best Mexican, not the worst. The salsa is a little watered down, but I liked it. I got a quesadilla and hubs got fajitas. Both portions were huge. After dinner they bring a little fried pastry for a sweet bite on the house.   For a casual Mexican meal, Azteca did the trick. I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch menu

lgITqTUHUnqZh8EKNFRLMw.text: Not my favorite Mexican restaurant. The food did not have much flavor to it, it was bland and to me it tasted like frozen food. The service was not the best either. I did not enjoy my time at Aztecs Restaurant and I was really looking forward to trying it out. It has been a struggle to find a Mexican spot to enjoy outside of uptown. Unless I get dragged along by my friends, I do not think I will be returning unfortunately.

4hgP0silgytcuxczdCsMPA.text: The best Mexican in Charlotte! Don't let the fact that it's attached to a days inn off Woodlawn deter you... My family has been coming here for as long as I can remember - I'd guess over 15 years, no lie. Do yourself a favor and drive the 2 miles out of South End, away from the trendy instagram Mexican spots that are popping up, and give this gem a try. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu but I'd argue the fajitas are a must try for any first timer. Delicious salsa/pico de gallo, rice and beans, and margaritas. It's a fun atmosphere on Cinco de Mayo as well!

v7WHxRkkQSeAIUdJ3fkjUw.text: Not sure what everyone sees in Azteca. I have been several times since 2013, my last review, and am just not impressed. Service is always horrible and I always feel very rushed! They try and turn tables and it is not a good customer experience.  As for the food, the salsa is runny and the cabbage slaw always has a rancid flavor. As for entrees, nothing really stands out. Most recently I got the fajitas and the Chicken wasn't great and the vegetables were even cooked. The beans and rice are okay but I feel like they sit on the plates and get heated up right before being served. Half the time the rice a overcooked because of that. I will say the fresh made guacamole is good. Definitely don't pass that up. Drinks are not fresh...the Margarita tastes like a pre-made mix, very sour. Learn to make a fresh Margarita.  There are definitely better Mexican options in my mind and probably will not return.

ZmLcobUInZfgDaRuULNeHw.text: Tamales bad/dry, Chile relleno bad/bland/flat.  Frozen margaritas, disgusting and sent it back. Tasting like bleach and everclear. Margarita on the rock, still horrible but didn't send it back. Not assss bad as the frozen but still horrible.

M7VmIJJLk047GP_oMsaxJA.text: I haven't been to Azteca in probably a decade, but I was in Charlotte last Sunday and ate there this weekend. It was good. Just like I remembered - with their chips and salsa, they also served some vinegar based cole slaw that I forgot about until I started eating it again. Good stuff. The booth that I and my friend sat in was tight and we felt claustrophobic (we are bigger guys who need a bit more room). They should widen the booths we sat in by at least 5 inches or take out one of the booths and reorganize the booth area. It really did seem tight, unless you are a really skinny family. In retrospect, we should have asked to switch to a table.  The food was just as I remembered it. Well above average and the portions were just as good. I love hot salsa and was disappointed that asking for extra hot salsa costs $3 more.   I'm vegetarian and asked if the macho burrito (a burrito that has cactus, rice, beans and other veggies in it) had refried beans or whole black beans in it and was told it had the black beans in it. Being told it had whole black beans in it, I ordered it. However, it had both refried beans and whole black beans. The problem I have with this is that most Mexican restaurants don't understand that lard (pig fat) is quite often an ingredient of refried beans. A few bites in, I realized there were refried beans in this burrito. I didn't feel like causing a problem and decided to assume they knew what vegetarian meant and since their menu said it was vegetarian, the refried beans are actually vegetarian. Next time I go, I will ask more questions or order it without refried beans. By the way, this burrito is HUGE. You will not walk away hungry.   Service was pretty good. I did have to wait about 5 minutes between receiving the check and paying for it. I wasn't in a hurry and the restaurant was really full of people, so that wasn't a big issue with me.   Overall, I can recommend this restaurant. It's a good step above a standard Mexican restaurant. You will get good food here.

CMYx7r9i7tlU4jApHVpbtw.text: Top 3 in my book.... food was great, and the Long Island ice tea was LIT!! I'll be back no doubt.

njF5Ed0hS2u6tUhJX4aXQw.text: Food was delicious but our waiter messed up two orders and took forever to bring water to the table. Great margaritas though!

r9MUfKNh8KyYzkzwWdnt_A.text: This is probably my favorite Mexican place in town. They have such large servings and everything I've had is delicious. I was told they have a mariachi band on Fridays, so looking forward to checking that out. Oh, and not to mention you get a small free dessert at the end. After pigging out on a heavy meal, it's honestly the perfect treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZP8s9R5KPQPDJsk7RNzzNw.text: I've been able to bridge the language barrier by learning how to speak my order in spanish :-)  I'm honestly glad this issue presented itself as it pushed me to put forth the effort in learning the vocabulary & now it's something I'm proud of & enjoy using to change the interaction dynamic  :-)

M1yeQ3gqjc6M7kMMUZfN8Q.text: I have been coming to Azteca for over 10 years and they never disappoint.  This is as authentic as Mexican cuisine gets ,as I know, in Charlotte. I have tried to go to other peoples go to spots and they just don't compare to the amount of flavor that Azteca has. They offer you salsa, slaw, and chips with each meal. The choices they have are endless. You cant go wrong with anything that comes with their refried beans and rice, it is LIFE. Margaritas are great. Its my tradition to come here every cinco de mayo (get their early, its everybody else's idea too), but they always have shirts with a margarita purchase every cinco de mayo and it makes the experience that much more fun. They end your meal with a little sweet dessert of a fried cinnamon chip.

_6wV4esDE2q_9ox_M08p5w.text: This restaurant was absolutely amazing. I was you're in town for a business trip and came in with a colleague you had it in the past. I was blown away great authentic Mexican food. I highly recommend the pork Carnitas

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

Fq1ycBJ6kaDvUGEMInL5FA.text: The staff is awesome! And the food is good. Come on Fridays to hear mariachis perform.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado tostada with beans rice and cabbage

SPBKkPN2LXqaLGJ4DejjQA.text: Loved it. Was starved after a long day with no lunch and found this place before flying home the next morning. Absolutely the best table side made guacamole I've ever had. Because they keep it simple. Perfectly rip avocados, minced onion, salt, fresh squeezed lime juice, a little jalapeno and tomato and a little cilantro. Then lightly smashed up to stay chunky. Was worth every penny. Then had a carne asada with grilled shrimp plate and everything was very good. Asada flavorful and tender and grilled as it should be. Great service and they make a decent michelada too. I will go back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada with grilled shrimp
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Table side made Guac
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Big michelada

mksyk3ihKN0OeU6P9na8MA.text: Shady location but amazing food and service. Live music was very good. Makes you think you really are in Mexico or Cozumel! Bring your family and friends you won't be disappointed. One negative is parking is really limited

4xBQiOv1dtnNjbPtZ4yM5w.text: The arroz pon collo was a great dish! The plates full of chicken and veggies to fill you up! Make sure to ask for the soft shells to go with it!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arroz pon pollo. Shells not shown

AomhABY36vwWWcwMfxJu-w.text: Came to Azteca after a day of shopping in the area and made a last minute change to our dinner plans. Our group wasn't very keen on fast food so we picked a restaurant near our hotel and settled quickly on Azteca. In retrospect, we should have read reviews before deciding on this restaurant. Chips and dip were served when we sat down but instead of red and white sauce we got red sauce and Cole slaw. Kind of interesting for a Mexican restaurant. My dining companion had chicken fajitas, I had the chicken taco salad. The fajitas were very well prepared and the chicken was delicious. The taco salad was not very good. Chicken tasted funny and was served with cheddar cheese instead of the typical Mexican cheese which mixed differently with the chicken. Overall, I would not return to this restaurant but it wasn't too terrible for a last minute late meal.

oUMufwd5AaZk-8z4gl1IPg.text: We chose this restaurant based on it's proximity to the hotel plus it's status on YELP and couldn't have been more pleased. The food and service here were nothing short of amazing. I couldn't decide what to order because the selection was ginormous and chose a combination place consisting of 1 enchilada, 1 chili relleno and a hard taco with rice, beans and their famous slaw. The cost for this ... on the largest plate I've ever seen ... was only $9.99. AMAZING! I had plenty to take home and devour later, which always makes me happy. There is a table side guacamole cart that is nothing short of incredible that you absolutely have to partake of. We ordered ours with all of the ingredients and couldn't help making the 'mmmmm' sound with the first bite. I never considered cilantro in making guacamole.  We ordered the small and it was plenty for the two of us.  We also treated ourselves to a pitcher of margaritas. The price for this HUGE pitcher was $25 and would have been a sufficient amount for 4 people. The two of us overindulged .. ;) .. and had plenty left over that we had to leave behind on the table. It seemed such a waste of the best margaritas (the ingredients were perfectly proportioned) that I have had in a long time. Actually thinking of coming back here before I leave Charlotte. OUTSTANDING.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The margaritas are absolutely marvelicious!!! Large portions with a decent price tag.

EyXUfKrveiuE_aBhD-SMhA.text: Absolutely terrible service! Yes, they seat you quickly, but the menus were thrown on the table and the server just left. Didn't ask if we wanted a drink or anything. They actually didn't say a word to us. The waiter took forever to serve us and never came to check on us to see if we wanted or needed anything else. I really wish I could have gotten his name, but maybe it helps for the establishment to know that we visited on 2/25/2017 around 8:30pm and sat directly across from the kitchen. When the waiter finally came back we asked for the check and waited a long time again for him to come back to the table. We were ready to leave and late for a meeting with some other people, so we decided to go to the counter to pay, but wow, he sure was quick that time to come to our table to tell us to pay at the table after waiting a lifetime for him to show up! Apparently, he thought we were trying to leave without paying! I was livid and have never been treated like that before! Good Lord! We didn't want to spend the night there!       I came here upon recommendation from some of our employees who like to eat here, but it is definitely not a place I care to ever visit again and I certainly would not recommend it to anyone that I know. We were treated like dirt! It doesn't help that it is also located in a sketchy part of town. The only thing good I can say about this place is that the food was OK.       If you are interested in great tasting Mexican food in a better area with better service, try Salsas in Steele Creek. Better service, better & safer location and a more pleasant staff. There are also many things to do nearby that you can walk to, safely.

2SKauDmmjDIR0sEmGUXQNw.text: They have the Best Salsa I have ever ate. I will be back to get more of this. An the Nachos was really good. A lot different than I have back home from where Im from.

SRyTTSDPlDLXPQ9OncmgOw.text: Azteca has been a favorite of mine since way before Yelp, so I am disappointed that my first visit since that time was my least favorite. I met my two best friends for what has become an annual before Christmas craziness dinner.    Azteca does have the best pico de gallo of any other place and our queso was delicious as well. My friends enjoyed to very delicious margaritas while I drank a cold Negro Medelo.   Dinner is where I found my self a bit disappointed.  We all ordered combination plates, mine was the taco with ground beef.  Our service was slow for the night and my plate arrived warm with one side of my corn tortilla taco completely soggy.    We had a very long wait for our checks which were split incorrectly and there was further confusion about how my one friend's visa was charged.  The waiter was was very appologetic and the situarion was resolved, but very awkward.  I am a great fan of Azteca, and I chalk this visit up to an off night.

F56I-Y18FJaxCtSk2jHJjQ.text: I love this place! They have the best fajitas, very flavorful! Also, the staff treats you like family. Best Mexican restaurant I have been to by far!

lwoyQVlw2MU6fAvMhZbJsg.text: Ordered the taco and enchilada lunch special with rice and beans. The food had no seasoning and was flavorless. The chips were served with salsa which was OK. Service was good. Probably won't come back here again and will head to La Unica or Monterrey in the future. The decor was nice inside but didn't make up for the disappointing, bland fare.

-eFBR8sXj9-7m9FNtLG_Wg.text: If I could give it more stars I would! Amazing food! The carne asada is so yummy! I'm from CA and picky when it comes to Mexican food, but this place didn't let me down. Absolutely amazing food!!

UTIoNQ4f3uJfm2EdEOiwGQ.text: My burrito was decent and the service was really friendly. They give you free chips and salsa and a sort of dessert chip at the end which was a nice touch.

1eZ1_fVES4VgfqEw9uRBCQ.text: Service was quick and friendly. Chips, salsa and "slaw" come right away.  I eat Mexican in some of the best places for it, so my rating more a "global" scale. For the Southeast, this place is above average.  First: salsa is ok. Pretty watery but good flavor. Chips seem house made-also good.   The "slaw" is very good. It's basically ceviche with no meat.   I ordered carnitas. Pork of course-they offer beef and chicken carnitas, which is weird. The portions are very large and come on a huge plate. Rice and beans were as expected (surprisingly they are sub-par at a lot of places-not here). Carnitas normally are hewn from a large roast (can be fried). They serve 1"cubes. Not really traditional. Pretty good flavor, but if you like carnitas, these won't satisfy. Served with pickled onions. Good but odd. Should be lots of fresh onions and cilantro.  Also, there was more slaw, and excellent nopal (cactus) salad. Corn tortillas were store bought, probably all that is avail here.  Guacamole is good, but not enough provided. Overall good, but I would order something different next time

ma9V_z1dSkAeGSWVGgy_rg.text: My family loves this place! My daughter just flew in from the UK on break from University and of course she chose Azteca for her first meal back in the States. The homemade guacamole is always a good choice and the margaritas are the best in town. Love you guys!

uzQg5KPkcPA5MkJ3H_8GpA.text: Who doesnt love this place?! COME ON! Ok, well I could live without the salsa, but the pico is ooooooh so good. I also dig that they offer Sol beer which is not easy to come by. I admit, I am not one to order the same thing every time I go out to eat, but I just cant stay away from the arroz con pollo. ARRRRRIBA! Take a bunch of amigos/amigas and enjoy a margarita or two and eat up...then go home with the leftovers. My guy and I had leftovers and I made a freakin casserole with them for god sakes. So much food!

T0Bs2_kMpiCel9FhDE7adw.text: The pros:  - Good service.  The hostess was friendly and seated me promptly.  Though my friend hadn't arrived yet, there was no prob to get a table and wait at the the table.  Throughout dinner our server was courteous and quick.  We also had, who I think is a manager, check on us a couple of times, and made sure we were ok.  - Fresh guac - As Dave S. pointed out (and thank you for the rec on this place!) there's a guy that goes table to table and offers fresh guac.  We sampled a bit and really liked it, so he served us a fresh bowl of it.  It's creamy, fresh, and very good!  - Basket of tortilla chips and salsa - The tortilla chips are right out of the oven, and are warm & crispy to perfection.  They serve them with a small bowl of salsa and a small plate of salad.  It took a lot of self control to not inhale the whole thing!  The cons:  - Few vegetarian/vegal options - The menu only has about three things to select if you're vegetarian and/or vegan.  Also my cheese enchillada was very bland and was brought out without any sauce on it, which was kind of odd.  I've had cheese enchilladas at so many other Mexican restaurants and they always serve it with salsa verde or standard red salsa, in this case I had to ask for a side bowl of red salsa.  - Mariachi Band - Ok, they're not a total "negative" but it was a little distracting having them blast their music at our table right when my friend showed up.  We hadn't seen each other in 2 years and were ready to catch up but all we could do was shout at each other b/c the band chose to perform right at our table.  As soon as we answered their request of what type of song to play, and they played a good chearful piece, and after we tipped them, they left, then we could actually eat and talk without raising our voices.  But the music was good and they were a nice group, so it's not all bad, just not great timing on their part.  Verdict:  I'd probably go back here if I was in the area, but not likely to go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mariachi Band
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Free dessert that comes with check
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tortilla chips basket with salad &amp; salsa

o7fLfOE-QMzZ7uQxW90EKg.text: Authentic Mexican, total dive but great value for the amount Of food you are served. Service is always fast, and they tons of seating inside and on the patio. You never have to wait long for a table.

1WFwILHZPWXEWBL9_jfdow.text: Right after we moved to Charlotte, I was talking to a local in a bar about how I wanted great Mexican food. He directed me to Azteca, and told me not to worry about the fact it was connected with a Days Inn.  That was 8 years ago, and after trying numerous Mexican restaurants in Charlotte, Azteca remains far and away our favorite. The food is delicious and the portions are huge for the price you pay. Service is always friendly and prompt. The restaurant is hopping on a Friday or Saturday night, and it's always a fun place to hang out.   The mariachi band that plays on the weekend is a blast. On one of our last visits, they asked us if we wanted them to play us a song. We said sure, but we didn't know which one, so we suggested they play us their favorite song. They chose Elvis, which cracked us up.  My husband loves the Arroz con Pollo. I switch around dishes, but lately my favorite is the Pork Carnitas. For $11, you get a plate with so much food on it that taking home leftovers is a must. We've had nothing but great visits to Azteca!

J8Svj7WIXuF1OXlsEk5-DA.text: The service was good!  But they literally brought my food out on a serving tray! Definitely worth the money! I got the Pollo Con Crema (sp) and It was delicious, so if you're ever riding down Woodlawn and want to get your belly full definitely stop by!!

khumWCyV59zhaSPP3GiLEg.text: My best friend and I came here Friday for dinner. I had the small portion of their chicken fajitas it was ok. The service was also ok I can say that they have good chips and salsa. I'll be coming back to this restaurant

souyXfXM8st7eKT8jTAQsQ.text: First timer earlier this week and food was great! In fact, going back tonight...Attn: Vegetarians like me, the Expresso vegetarian burrito is great! Especially with the cheese dip drizzled over the top nom nom nom

QXdpMtIEK3tEZX3OIHRqBw.text: Went there with the guys. Started off with a beer and their chips & salsa. The salsa is excellent with fresh cilantro. Also served with fresh slaw. I had the chicken chimi, with refried beans & rice. The chimi was cooked perfectly, not over deep fried like some places. It was quite tender. Wonderful flavor. The service was excellent, very attentive. Great staff. All this at bargain prices. We really enjoyed the place.

k0JEfLyM3Ra1eHdF2m100Q.text: Hungry day at work where I had eaten my lunch for breakfast. At noon the boss announces he has a hankering for mexican and we'll be eating at Azteca after cleaning up two more accounts and so it went :-\ We get seated right off and out comes chips, salsa, and pico-slaw followed by a pitcher of water and glasses (gotta stay hydrated because it's warm out) After a little rumination I go with breakfast for lunch: chorizo con huevos. Raging hot plate comes out shortly with scarbled eggs cooked through and sausaged-up nicely plus moist flavory rice and not-too-wet beans and a dish of floury tortillas. Happily tucked into it all alternating tortillas with mixed portions of beans, rice, eggs, and/or salsa. yea hot sauce! Afterward we were treated to cinnamon sprinkled tortillas with red jam for lasts; a simple but tasty treat. So yeah, I like Azteca pretty well. The price is right and the portions are filling. If I lived nearer I'd be in more often, since I'm not, I'm not.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. treats
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. chorizo con huevos
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. agua fria

uCDDxaK47O9SX-CIZwKy8A.text: Can't tell you how many times I've seen Azteca.  To be honest, I was a little scared since it was in a hotel, but Yelp suggested it and I listened.  What I didn't listen to was my server that said the food was hot.  As stated in many Mexican Restaurants, I thought he warned me the plate was hot (which he may have said too,) but the food was HOT.  Not spicy, as in just came off the grill let it cool hot.    Once I regained feeling in my tongue I enjoyed my meal. I had a combo with tacos and a quesadilla.  Subtle differences between it and the places I frequent at home.  Fresher veggies it seemed, but first Mexican place I've been too that used Cheddar cheese instead of the usual Mexicann melting cheese.  This is not a knock, just pointing it out.  Quick.  Good. Good Service.

OsLxP7AdW8TWqiLqzdvOqA.text: We had a bite to eat here before we went to the Dead and Company Show. I had the pork carnitas and my husband had the Chile Verde. The carnitas were crispy on the outside. They were just a tad dry. It did come with sour cream and guacamole, so that was helpful. We ordered a pitcher of Texas margaritas. They tasted more like regular lime margaritas and cost $30!The waiter was nice and attentive. The salsa was a little watery. Don't get too many refills on the chips and salsa or they will charge you. I saw it written on the menu.

Wb-yyx0awrzQncZV93pBOA.text: So far this is my favorite Mexican restaurant in charlotte! We always get rice, beans, and cheese dip. Then use the chips to eat this with. The ground beef tacos are our next go to but honestly they're not so good. We've tried enchiladas and burritos and have always liked them. My favorite is the churros, they're delicious and a huge portion. The only thing we have had that we weren't a fan of was the chicken nachos. They were tasteless and soggy by the time we got the pick up to our house.  When ordering pick up, always check your bag, they get the orders mixed up quite a lot but are happy to fix it.  Parking is easily available and we have never had to wait before being seated.  They easily have my favorite salsa in charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Churros for dessert!

7Ubt0Vz02Eazn4QF_s5png.text: I was surprised at how good the food was here! Looking from the outside, it's a no-frills restaurant. I should've known it was good because I had to park in the lot next door!  My food was prepared quickly and was fresh. My drink was just right and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

ibInKd9isJ_qrTHEQCT4RA.text: This place is an alright option for quick, order by number Mexican food in Charlotte. It's one of the better options in Charlotte for quick Mexican food, but it's still not a great option.   The parking lot is small, the place is right next to a cheap motel, and the restaurant is dated and feels dirty. The food is good and the portions are large.   For cheap Mexican in CLT this is a decent option, but it's not a place I come regularly or get very excited for.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ey-SBijlhtqGghjJUnDlGg.text: Chillllllllllllllllllldddd,  Shout out to the salsa boys, table guys and rotating service folks that help out.   This may be gringo haven numero uno. Como?   Even the kid complained the salsa wasn't hot nor flavorful. Pero, the chow chow Or lechuga tomato blend was fiyahh. I say chow chow for those familiar with Haitian or Creole Louisiana foods.   Anywhoo. This isn't exactly Texmex nor Mexican. It is a hybrid of large plates, tex-mex meets the coast?!?!? Idk. No se.   The chimichanga wasn't covered in queso. I had a tostada with shredded beef which is the star with an up charge.  I started this in May and it's the end of July. Best to them.  Hard pass for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side Guac = $2.95 &amp; not worth it

h46kGtU6jZQTzPHLQsBbcQ.text: I have my favorite "authentic" Mexican spot, but sometimes I'm just not in that area, and Azteca is a good second.   I have only come to this spot for lunch, but I've never been disappointed. Their service is spot on, and their food is always hot and delicious! They do have different lunch specials each day and a whole menu section dedicated to lunch items. Every meal comes with chips and salsa, as well as a vinegar based slaw. I've ordered different lunch items and have enjoyed each one. I will say their rice is never anything to write home about, but I think it's more of a "plate filler" than anything else. Their refried beans are really tasty, and are a great compliment to all their tacos, enchiladas, and tostadas.   If you're in the neighborhood, you should definitely pop in and check this place out. They know how to bring in a lunch crowd!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch number 33 - tostada and enchilada with beans and rice. Lots of food for $7

lp4IXnkSx6tT8f10ohJlkA.text: First time visiting to this place, food was average. Service was good. They have a good patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

hcQ8geVo0t7imzcJBwDaFA.text: Have ordered this restaurant to go many a times! Every time the order is correct and delicious! I typically go for a quesadilla but everything I've had is great. Especially love the white queso.

YXiuxKRxWTbR8qzyMkqDEg.text: I've been to the University location of Azteca before, and while I remember the food being fine, it wasn't a particularly memorable experience. This past Friday night at the Woodlawn Azteca was very memorable, for all of the right reasons.  My boyfriend and I showed up around 7pm on Friday night - prime dinner time in Charlotte. We had been in Asheville last weekend and had become begrudgingly accustomed to hearing "Oh, an hour...hour and a half, maybe," upon asking how long the wait for a table would be, so when the host at Azteca seated us immediately, we could have both cried from happiness.   Our table was in the back of the restaurant, so we had a great view of the night's festivities - and festivities is what they were. There was live music - a 5-piece band, wandering the restaurant. It was so fun! The whole atmosphere felt like a Friday night party.   Service was fast and friendly. Table-side guacamole was made for us the second we sat down, and my margarita arrived in record time. My boyfriend ordered one of his favorite Mexican dishes (for the life of me, I can't remember what it was called - it was chicken and stir-fry veggies with spicy rice) and I opted for the chicken flautas, which were crispy and flavorful and absolutely delicious. It was a perfect, huge, satisfying meal.  Our waiter was hilarious and adorable and made us feel like his only table, despite the restaurant being at capacity. I could not have asked for a more perfect date night!

Es6YzbWWLSFxTMZJtFwcXA.text: I got to come here for a lunch outing with my team from work. The service was very prompt and our server checked in on us constantly. I really appreciated how nice she was and that she always stopped to check us even if it was just to see if we needed our drinks topped off. The food was okay. I got a ground beef chalupa and it wasn't the best I ever had or anything but it was good. The chips and salsa are always so addictive at any Mexican restaurant but the salsa here was a bit runny which I don't typically go for. I really enjoyed their queso dip and using it on not only the chips but my rice and refried beans as well. All in all eating as Azteca wasn't bad by any means.

CJTz-lThEUCtu0HHYozxYQ.text: Saturday night. Party of 20. My friend and I ordered: Super Nachos and Camarones con hongos. (Mushrooms). Good. We had a lot of fun. Singing Karaoke till they were  closing. I highly recommend the "Margarita". Pedro was a great waiter. Thank you Azteca. Definitely coming back! Ps: you can't go and skip the guacamole with chips. And there's more parking in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita

l1uuR4lwzL_mHh0iHNpJMg.text: Service is prompt and food came out quick. Food was your standard American Mexican fare. Nice vibe, however got pretty loud especially when they turned on the karaoke. Prices were good. I had a good experience.

02D11SQfrogQ_EtpQ8v5jg.text: When here for lunch with my dad. This is his favorite restaurant. I can tell why just by going there. It's located in a busy area. But easy to find. There are 4 locations and we went to the Woodlawn location. Service was good. Anthony was our waiter. They have a lunch special every day for $5.75. I got a grilled chicken quesadilla. It came with rice and beans. I even witnessed them make fresh guacamole for a family nearby. Smelled wonderful!

cbvGf6hLUlce2QnCWYmrYw.text: Ok soooo good!! The portions are huge!! So if you aren't really hungry I suggest splitting your meal with someone. The guacamole is life... made in front of you

NGwgTek-5wnv7EtAeuaysg.text: I love this place for fast but good mexican. In the old days we would frequent a place in town called Chi Chi's. After that left Charlotte we found Azteca on Woodlawn, we never looked back. That was many many years ago and today the food is still great! Bottomless free chips and salsa, excellent guac, every dish is served quickly and hot whether it's lunch or dinner, busy or not! To me the interior seems like it has remained the same all these years but I love that, it's like visiting an old friend. I highly recommend Azteca for fast, good mexican! Also parking is free and it's located conveniently close to I-77.

sRWkh-JKmaJhhpBUA2vkqg.text: This place is hustling and bustling when we first got here - always a great sign during lunch. I came here with coworkers and we were promptly seated. Chips were provided with salsa and a pico type topping. The lunch specials from 11-3 on weekdays were amazing. I ordered the shrimp fajitas and they were cooked well and it was very tasty.   Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp fajita lunch special
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch specials.

_PXuPAY1tTsC7AfosIIYkA.text: Amazingly good Mexican Restaurant!!! Favorite in the Charlotte area.  Great Fajitas and Burritos.  Please, PLEASE make your Tortillas from scratch!!! The factory ones you serve (Mission/ChiChi's???) are just meh, no flavor and texture is way too thick.  Your food is homemade amazing, make the Tortillas equal the above!!!!

JH8_tm0nbTKHUjhR47mzvQ.text: I'm not a huge Mexican fan, but I always have a good time when I come here! (Go on Fridays. That's when the mariachi band comes :D) A little after we were seated, the mariachi band came over to our table. They asked if they could play a song for us. OF COURSE YOU CAN!! But umm.. we didn't know what song to request so we asked for a "happy" song haha (I guess I should brush up on my latin songs beforehand next time lol) They were so sweet! Near the end of our meal, they came back to ask if we would like another. Of course we said YES! Don't forget to tip btw :)  There was a birthday party beside us and the servers embarrass the birthday girl/boy with a sombrero hat as the mariachi band gathers with birthday songs :) It is a great place for birthdays. The space isn't that big, but they can accommodate large crowds. Plus, being here always makes me more cheery!

KbnD9-SbrAyqedh7f504Qg.text: Everything from this place was five stars. Food taste like heaven and the service is absolutely wonderful! Great place to have a great time!

CPQztlhIlD8HZYNod3sTeQ.text: Staying in hotel by Azteca Mexican. Husband ordered take out, Sopa Azteca large $6.99 for me and Pollo a la crema $14.49 for him, paid $34.10 and a tip!I Walked to pick up order my phone number receipt (with order written correctly) Thought it was a bit high. Got back to hotel opened the bag, soup  was mixed seafood $19.25 Pollo crema $12.25 Called immediately and was told that I should have read receipt when I picked up order..THEY WERE RUDE and acted like they didn't speak English.  Apparently Azteca Mexican Rest takes  advantage of hotel guests!!! Guess they can't make an honest buck!! What happened to pleasing the customer? BAD BUSINESS PRACTICE ... I intend to tell everyone I know not to support this business

cLGvlwU8ugqlfSkmypfV5w.text: Outstanding.  This place is the real deal.  So authentic. So tasty.  Family of 4 passing through Charlotte for the night and stopped by...left feeling like I'd never eat again for $85.  Would definitely stop by again if I was in the area.  Parking kinda sucks @ dinner time and you need to park in a shady Days Inn lot.

LWaghzAoBx06dURzwTsXxw.text: This is probably the WORST customer service I have EVER received. Called and made a reservation for 15 on Thursday for tonight. They wrote it down for the complete wrong date. They then refused to seat us until our whole party was here even though THEY messed up our reservation. They told us they had a table for us and then gave it away even though they told us it was available for us. The woman at the host stand yelled at the host who told us our table was available in Spanish saying they couldn't seat us without everyone here and we were only missing one person. We have been here over an hour and still have not been sat and have had all of our party for 45 minutes. Bar service is awful as well. The guy totally forgot two of our drinks and didn't listen when we told us to split it. Never coming back and still haven't even eaten. Edit: just ordered and my quesadilla came an hour later and wasn't good at all and my boyfriend's order was completely incorrect. No point in sending them back because they'll just spit in it. Never coming back.

TQplSBIWN9-dF6QpYDRilA.text: Not the best Mexican food Charlotte but definite top five. Great family place. Have live mariachi music occasionally too. Good food and reasonably priced. Large restaurant, good for parties. Always a fun time.

hGppHlZK7mVQ3fuGmTN5pg.text: Good, authentic Mexican.  Big portions and low prices.  Try the carnitas de puerqo.  Nice atmosphere and friendly wait staff.

RvCxU2SoBPUdckIdRsUTsA.text: Pleasantly surprised! Even after reading the positive reviews for Azteca I was still a little hesitant walking into the place. I have dissonance around finding a good restaurant attached to a mid-range hotel.   When you walk in, it's like walking in a little tunnel. The front area is really small too and if you arrive with a lot of people, your personal space bubble becomes almost non-existent. We asked for a booth and yes, the tables are very close together. The staff are friendly and they especially warm-up if you speak Spanish.   We ordered the "Macho" and veggie fajitas. Very good and large portions! We also ordered the fresh guacamole since many of the previous reviews raved about this. Even though it was delicious, I thought it was a tad pricey ($7 for one avocado) after thinking it was only $3 (I guess I mis-read the menu). The salsa was on the watery side and I'm accustomed to the chunkier, but it was still good.   As we were leaving, a table was having a birthday and it was such a fun site to see! Most of the staff came out singing and sombreros in hand. At the end of the birthday song, one of the waiters got up on a chair and was pretending to do a little strip-tease with his apron. Hilarious.   Good food, good fun...and if you are lucky, you'll witness a birthday celebration!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh guacamole

_Szw32nG3IoM7cSyEEoHBQ.text: Impressively consistent poor service.  Been there 12 times but the tasty guacamole and carne asada can only distract me for so long before I break! They are downright mean and lazy.  Go to Don Pedro.  Same corporate owners and recipes but better staff.  'Nuff said!

9y1rnjwvcONYPwAgyJ80nQ.text: We moved to the other side of Charlotte and keep coming back because we haven't found a better Mexican restaurant.    We go every Friday night.   Get there early with the baby because she loves the mariachi band.   If you go enough, they remember your drink order and bring it with them to the table before you can even order.   Like hot? Order salsa verde with chips Get the tortilla soup.   So good and hearty.   It's a meal.   Grande beer is best bang for buck.   2.5 beers in one mug.    We usually share one and get out the door cheap.   LOVE this place.

egB2iqnStbfD3WFzJ3Qiqg.text: Such. Good. Food.  Seriously...huge portions, good prices, friendly service, festive atmosphere. Love it!

aXp7okZx6RmVr4BLdHm-4A.text: Food was delicious! And that's kinda surprising since California we have tons of good Mexican restaurants. But I we are ever back in Charlotte we will be back here to eat again.

zK5tYrjHQJ3qWtVoaF_sag.text: The entrees are okay but have a salt taste. The tables are tile-topped so the tile grout collects dirt and germs. I have been in better Mexican places where the tops are custom and very colorful however they have a piece of glass or Lexan over top of them to keep the eating surface clean. Last time I was in here there were 2 kids running around their table and the adults, including the waitresses didn't care one bit that my ears were ringing from screaming. I guess that is an occasional part of the "authentic" experience. The prices are a bit high for the quality of the food. The food isn't horrible, but it is really just average. People rave about this place, even going as far as saying its the best Latino food they've ever had, even traveling to Latino countries. I don't get it. One of the same yelling children was licking the top of a salt shaker in front of the adults and wait staff, nobody seemed to care. I had to tell the waitress to probably remove that salt shaker since the little girl was licking it. Beware salt shakers at this place with clogged tops, it may be from dried saliva. The place has a nice decor but overall they stay so busy (again, I am baffled as to why) and that causes the cleanliness of the place to be below average. Wait staff is friendly however can be too long between table visits, and then when at the table once can be pushy. Unfortunately I will come back as my girl and her family say its the best, driving 40 minutes from home in SC to come here. I have eaten Mexican food my whole life, authentic and otherwise, and this place to me is average at best. Not positively memorable in terms of deliciousness, cleanliness or value. Yes you get a lot of beans and rice with the food but that's like going to Thanksgiving at someones house and bragging about the portions because half your plate was piled with Stove Top. If my experience here improves, I will be sure to apologize and update my rating, but after 3 or 4 visits, I am doubtful.

BIhXMdTl9PxIUx0eskeDGA.text: Loved the place! Service was really good. Guacamole on the table was just as I wanted. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends.

eGzkls8OsqgVdktyZP4Paw.text: I love Azteca!  My family has been eating here for over 10 years.  The food and service is excellent. Some could consider this to be Tex-Mex but it is more authentic Mexican food with local favorites like Arroz Con Pollo.  If you're searching for good Mexican food, look no further!  I highly recommend this restaurant and specifically the Woodlawn location for the authenticity.

tGHyIk47QZCEQcj5Qpka-A.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.  I love this place and have been here a thousand times.  This is my go to when I am in the mood for cheese and carbs.  It's inexpensive and delicious.  Get there now if you are not interested in the upscale Mexican places and want something super casual.

xgzw0VMKzTm2JDYlO9SUcA.text: We rarely go out on my birthday because it's a major dining holiday - Valentine's Day.  But this time the whole family got together and I chose Azteca, thinking it wouldn't be "too" badly crowded.  Well, it was full, but SO festive and fun!  We sat at the bar while we waited for our table for 7, and the bartender was entertaining and quick with our margaritas, even making a little virgin margarita for the youngster with us.  We got our table fairly quickly, and we kept our waiter entertained and coming back and forth pretty quickly, too, considering the room was full of party groups.  As always, the food was filing and delicious!  This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants, and it was really good to be back, and share it with 3 in our party who had never been.  They are now fans, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

H0tgXNek0WX_cAJCr63m6Q.text: Try carne asada. You wont be disapointed. Very large food portion. Good price. Welcoming enviroment, and its authenthic mexican food with mexicans cooking the food.

nAhJAy0v9-GQ0DDxOdFPTA.text: Used to be really good, but I guess they got too comfortable. I used to be a regular here. Then I went once earlier this year and noticed a huge downgrade in quality of the food & ingredients used and in the service provided. Hoping it was just a bad day- I went back again but had the same less-than-stellar experience. Don't plan to go back.

F8a_ZW7o5dlXhwYSt0FN0A.text: Not a bad place for your Mexican food.  Food - if you order a small platter, you will get a good amount of food. The larger platter will fill you up and beyond. If you are like me, I had to pack the rest for to-go. I believe waiting for our food, while loading up on their salsa/guacamole sauce + chips, really got me. Don't scrimp on the guacamole, it's good!  The tamales/enchilada combo was what I had ordered. Although, the shredded beef tamale was not wrapped in the corn shuck, which takes the fun out of unwrapping your tamales.  Enchilada looked messy, but surprisingly good!! Overall, I'd come back, when I feel for Mexican.  Service - good and attentive.  No complaints here.  Place - you get a good Aztecan vibe!   **Cinco de Mayo is coming up, order their house margarita, you get a free shirt!

JvDfAa-K4SVBbxBFtXtgiQ.text: DO NOT ORDER CHEESE ENCHILADAS.   I got a la carte cheese enchiladas.   How can u mess that up, right?? Wrong!!   I am adding a pic to show everyone.  They were covered with cheddar cheese. Weird but I went with it.   The cheddar is also inside.  No white cheese.  Shredded cheddar cheese throughout.  Wtf??   It was nasty nasty Nasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Instead of cheese enchiladas I received Nasty &#34;cheddar cheese&#34; enchiladas.  Wtf???

PHaO5ZFesCFxkoE9K80Eyw.text: We were visiting from out of town and found this spot as it was near our hotel.  The exterior was a little underwhelming, but the dining room is very inviting, cute bar area, and very friendly staff.  The bottomline is the food though, and it was excellent.  The house Margaritas are good, and our entrees were all very good, an excellent value for a mid-range priced restaurant of this type.  If it was located in Minneapolis it would be in our regular rotation.  Highly recommended.

q9scKgsDMPUcvhz5n9I1Tw.text: Within walking distance from many hotels in the area if your flight was cancelled. Open late. Great service. I recommend the table side prepared guacamole dip. Plates are HUGE! Food comes super quick. Margaritas are a must. The largest size came in what can only be described as a giant fish bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Table side guacamole awesome

6Shdld-9nEEq62ITWVMEvg.text: Service was really slow, however we were there on lunch midweek. I can look past those kind of things, next problem was our food. My buddy ordered a hard taco and two enchiladas and I ordered Mexican story fry. Food comes out and his "hard" taco is SOAKED in grease and juices from the enchiladas. My meal was alright, really greasy though. Just based off of this experience since it's my first time, I won't say I won't come back. It will just be quite a while until I give it another shot. Would not recommend to anybody.

-7usnEZ8EV2Nq2gfUK204g.text: Great service.  Fresh ingredients. Large menu.

TT9V2lAxkbjN9qG6C7N11w.text: Needed to update the rating of this place as four stars is misleading.  I've been back here a couple of times through the past couple of years, and the food and service has slowly deteriorated.  The food issue was that the grub is not so good anymore and the service issue is there is a lack of attentiveness.  Came here at the start of 2014 with a friend to catch up on a busy December, but made it difficult to talk bc the restaurant was such an issue.  Trying to get the attention of a waiter, waiting on tortillas while the fajita plate got cold, and drinks empty for most of the time.    I'm probably done here.  It feels like the quality of Mexican food is improving in Charlotte overall, so no need to rely on just this location.  dmo out.

6KbN2tf4DxHvjO0uBne-4w.text: Very ethnic feel. I appreciate that they are open late. I bought dinner for my dad and he almost ate the plate!

bu1i3ufdrLCjNixe00Uu_A.text: If you're looking for authentic Mexican in Charlotte, go here! Great service, great atmosphere and great food! We were so impressed and will definitely be back! Tip- ask for the hot sauce because it is delicious!

par_PKcUuxlflBapv6OCwQ.text: Arriving here you must first clear a gauntlet of bees, get passed the gross garbage can holding the door open. Then once you get you order (to go) you are given the tiniest (about 1/32 cup) of salsa. The owner, Maria, says that's all I would get with my $18 order. Any more salsa I have to pay $1.25 for the same 1/32 cup size. RIDICULOUS!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salsa is hard to come by at this Mexican restaurant.

3FQUDmV1klKVg6fFyCo3VA.text: Chose Azteca over another Mexican restaurant nearby based on the reviews on yelp and I'm glad I did.  Sat at the bar and had a 32oz beer and chips and salsa in front of me almost immediately.  Decided to order the chicken fajitas and they were delicious. After eating all of the chips and salsa, I ended up being able to bring home 2 fajitas.  I didn't get the table side guac, but I saw it made for 2 different tables nearby and it looked great. They also lowered the price from what some people are reviewing...$6.95 for one avocado and $8.95 for 2.  Great place to grab some delicious Mexican food. Their lunch menu looked really great and cheap too.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas, chips and salsa, and a 32oz Pacifica!

OZKm4CaMBupr6hhRvPlwVA.text: Bad service.  Had to ask for salsa three times.  Guys next to us came in 10 minutes after we did and got served first.  We walked out and won't go back.

OZPu1B0AwGYLz9L5IV3mHA.text: This place is amazing, great food, drinks, staff. I would go every week if I lived closer.

LPsMBNvA8LWFl_aVThrUog.text: The food was pretty good for Mexican food in the south.  Salsa was good, tacos were soggy, tamale was good, service was fine.

hUSpsrFsey2XK0DDWTVyGg.text: Great place. One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the Charlotte area. I recommend the guacamole. Service, environment, and food were all great. 5 stars!

f7gwnwngHJqVg8511ZQE6Q.text: I've been going to your restaurant since I was a little girl and it's literally one of my favorite places in the world to eat! Their service is awesome their customer service is awesome and everytime I eat there the food is always great!! To me you guys have the best fajitas in the world, anytime I want Mexican food you guys are the restaurant I choose!!!

SA-mjID-AOL9QLUzljf_WA.text: We went there to celebrate my friends birthday, and they didn't even come to our table but once. It seemed like they completely forgot about us. No celebrations were had, not even a "Happy Birthday"

N52EotAJ1QDtVe3fdtuyxA.text: Ahhhh, Azteca. You never disappoint! Another one of my "go - to spots", my best friend and I frequent here. Salsa is okay. Margaritas are always good! Everything I have ordered here has been yummy. I'm obsessed with cheese enchiladas though. And the rice and beans is soo GOOD!   They can make guac at your table. GUAC! @ THE TABLE!!! And if you're lucky, you'll get the live mariachis to sing for you. Don't forget to tip them!  Don't forget to save room for the OH SO DELICIOUS caramel cheesecake. It's a MUST HAVE!!

ol_N7uDYR5JZGxoEuyvlHA.text: Margarita was awful, sour & served in a warm glass. Food was okay at best. Salsa is very watery, has a chipotle / smoke flavor which I wasn't a fan of. Much better Mexican places out there. Staff was friendly and quick.

6l1tYiZb9juWIqRBTnS9dA.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants. The shrimp fajitas are amazing!!!!! We always receive great service when we visit and my husband love their guacamole that they make at your table.

EyrmltVWcgSxdqCrJ-S-uw.text: Staying close to the airport for an early flight the next morning, we were just looking for sustenance. Decor was over the top colorful and overflowing. Oh well, at least the chips were good and warm and service was fast and friendly. I asked the waiter for suggestions and went with the arroz con pollo expecting a bland Americanized version. Looking around, most of the patrons were Mexican families, a good sign. The plate was the size of a medium pizza and overflowing with food. More like a stew, the entree was huge, full of flavor. The best I've had by far. Authentic Mexican. Outstanding.

K1D4ozUVr_-oKk94unvJEw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants for Mexican cuisine. My brother in law  uses a phrase , "sitting on swole", (as in swollen). This phrase aptly describes any meal from Azteca. The food is EXCELLENT and the portions are plentiful.  There is rarely a wait to be seated and if there is a wait it's well worth it. I make a hearty meal a must any time I'm  in the area. The shredded beef is OUTSTANDING! Good stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sopitas. Fried sugar and cinnamon tortillas topped with whipped cream and a fruit coole. MMmmm!
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two Shredded Beef Burritos with Mexican rice and refried beans topped with cheedar.  Coleslaw on the side.
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carnitas Beef Burrito with guacamole and sour cream. Mexican rice and refried beans topped with cheedar.

N_ZakfPhOFztr3N6GWeg2A.text: Tonight we had to walk out of my favorite Mexican restaurant. After being seated immediately in the dining room, in the front, first booth behind the register. The restaurant wasn't very busy maybe 8 to 12 people in the dining room, but there was no wait staff to be seen, after waiting more than 10 mins for someone to acknowledge our presence my husband decided to grab the closest waiter and asked him to help us. Instead of being apologetic for making us wait, because he had already taken and returned with a drink order of a couple that came in after us, he was rude and snapped stating "I am coming now!" and we told him what we would like to drink and before he left I asked him if we could go ahead and place our dinner order(since we had been waiting a long time already and had more than enough time to look over the menu) and he reluctantly said yes. Ok I've lived here in Charlotte all of my life and I've been eating here since I can remember, I ordered one of my usuals chicken chimichanga no onions please, when the waiter quickly spoke up and said I could not order chicken chimichangas without onions... Wait? What?  So in order to avoid what was already to be a very bad dining experience. I just excused ourselves and left... Im very disapointed with Azteca.. And I can't say I will never return but in the years I have been eating there I've had slow service but this was blatently rude and unwilling to accomodate...

4fhCqAZxNSUX0vRlPfMD1g.text: Terribly plain. Haven't been to this location in quite a few years, and now that I've gone back to order some takeout food, I will not be coming back. The chimichanga that I ordered had nothing on top of it when I had asked for everything that it came with except for the sour cream. There was a tiny little dab of guacamole on the side, virtually no lettuce, no tomatoes, and the rice and beans were so flavorless that I could've made it better tasting for myself at home. Next time I'll walk across the street to Sabor Latin Street Grill where they have much better food with much better flavor and a much lower price. Will not be coming back here again.
