tsPbQOIbawYsWKek50DJUw.text: The absolute best Mexican food in Charlotte. Great service, great food and a great atmosphere.   I had tried several places since Texas and Azteca is by far the best in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

sLoc97yfC3K-Fepkl0PUgA.text: Based off of reviews we decided to try this place. First of all I have no idea why some people would be discouraged because it's connected to a Days Inn because it's basically it's own little Mexican place with cute outside seating too. The prices are great and portions are too! We split the large combo and added a taco to it and everything was awesome! We are huge Mexican fans and will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large combo platter with a taco added!

t_L1uKHIPV6aqOyuVsQ0Jg.text: A defining trait of a good Mexican restraint can be found in their salsa. This salsa falls short, tasting like tomato soup with some chopped onions in it. And if you find yourself not a fan of this watery red liquid, well to bad. Because, you are about to see that exact red sauce on every plate that comes out. That's right, enchiladas covered in the "salsa" , burritos drenched, fajitas swimming in it....they put it on everything with a shameless pride. Also beware Saturday nights, it is Spanish karaoke night, and the music "horns mostly" are turned up to ear splitting levels. A request to turn it down and be able to hear the person across the table, will be met with a smile and an "okay" without any results. Send three people and it'll still be a smile and an "okay" ...which is how I would feel if the manager came up and asked me how my meal was. (Smile) "it's okay"

NcjCuHZTdfYVyE9wWYUaag.text: This is my favorite 'dirty' mexican restaurant. I say that meaning the type of mom & pop Mexican place you think of with the combo meals that have a variety of things with rice and beans.... not your "upscale" mexican like Cantina.   Food is always good, and comes out pipping hot! Huge portions, and they have a great little patio area for the nicer weather months! Parking is a little weird though, most of it is back by this sketchy motel.

4NdMUs56R_lYgXwaRN6F8Q.text: Hands down my favorite place to get Mexican. I visit this location often and have an excellent experience. Food is always excellent and the queso is highly recommended!

LQF8Jk0q5kzgRBQsHm1l7g.text: Great staff. Super friendly. 100% authentic Mexican food. Not fancy but sooo good! Don't be scared when you pull up and it's connected to a days inn! Their fajitas and mojitos are yummy and their table side guacamole is a must. Ask for Nery, he's a great server! Sit on the patio if the weather allows! This place is consistent and reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas add mushrooms mojito and table side quacamole

BqEYLf7hf2U_x78eicIoxg.text: THE most horrible dining experience. The worst customer service. Drinks were bad. Complained and asked for a different drink after a small swig. They refused. Ok. Sucked it up. Food came out horribly. Manager came out after we complained of food and told my  dining companions that her problem was that she talked too much! What? Then brought out the menu (which they had 2 different ones) and asked if we pointed to the picture for the order. Really? Saying we need to call the owner. NEVER AGAIN!

OswvyAMuZlR7z_sb-CHCkQ.text: I have been to this location many time and this was the first time we have ever received poor service. Normally we come during lunch when it is super busy and receive very good service. Not sure what happened tonight but service was just as slow as the business. I left super unhappy and upset.  When we got there the hostess seat us in the bar area. Table was really small since there was 3 of us and a newborn. It took about 10 mins before someone even came to take our drink order and food order. It also took forever for our food to come out. Had to wait also for our drinks to be refilled. Asked twice for more salsa since they only gave 1 small bowl for 3 ppl to share and that didn't come till after our food hit the table. Which then it wasn't needed. Our whole dinning experience took an 1hr and 45mins. At the end of our meal we got tired of waiting for our missing server to give us the check so we had to go up front to the rude hostess to pay.  Your servers and hostess need to be train on customer service. The food was good but service was horrible. I will never return to this location.

W8fcHMxAGkVkmHDO6LgnrQ.text: The salsa was delicious. Full of flavor. Their meals are large. Our table of 5 took home as much as we ate. All the food was good and the staff was very attentive. Will mark this to come back.

Riqtw1dFHkoxrsOGTPgOWA.text: Absolutely delicious!!!!  Carne asada, tacos, enchiladas, quesadillas, etc....dinner was PERFECT. I love the homemade tomatillos hot salsa. Free sopspias (so?) for dessert were very good. Top notch service and very clean. We can't wait to come back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy!!!
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome cheese dip!!!
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco and Enchilada!!!

mx37JYTwZEMAnz2fmYVzzw.text: The beau and I came in late on a Friday night, but the restaurant was still packed. No wait, quickly seated over at a booth near the bar.   We each ordered a drink - I had a margarita (fairly good, had better!) and he had a draft beer (Modelo - can't go wrong!)   At first the service was fairly good - we quickly received water and the drinks that we had ordered from the bar, but then after that it was like we were nonexistent.   We ordered cheese dip that took forever to come out (very nice portion size I might add though). Their salsa taste like marinara sauce and its watery- it's horrible. However, their hot salsa (upon request) is great though, if you haven't tried it- and care for spicy-it's wonderful!  We sat and waited for almost 25 minutes when I finally got up and found our waiter and told them we were ready to order. Then by that time we sat for another 30 minutes waiting on our food when they weren't even that busy!   The food it's self was pretty good though, I had chicken fajitas and the seasoning on the fajitas part was great! My boyfriend had a chicken quesadilla and he really enjoyed.   However, at the end of the night when it was all said and done we decided that we wouldn't be back here unless we were in a pinch for something quick. We decided that there were other Mexican restaurants with better customer service in Charlotte!

0Wmh-M3WTwTtaJmPHr7Zkg.text: Have been going there for over 20 years. The food and service have always been good. Then on the evening of march 24th we went to have dinner with some friends there. The food and service were good as usual, But, when we were done eating, we were just sitting there talking with our friends, as friends often do when dinning together, and our waiter proceeds to tell us that if we are done  can we be on our way because they have people waiting to be seated. Kind of baffled, we were like okay.... Then as we left there were barely a few people waiting. Guess I should've ordered desert or a post dinner drink so that maybe they would have allowed us to sit and visit for the amount of time we chose. I didn't think this was a very good way to treat a long time good customer, Or any customer. Probably won't be back any time soon, Or recommend to others, as I wouldn't want others to experience this type of treatment.   -Regretfully let down

kZFB1oYfCVMnhStnxaeKgQ.text: Good service. Average Mexican food. Bathroom horrible condition. Only stopped here because we were in a hurry. Parking around back in seedy motel parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

3PLZQFYwLZreHf6YVd29dg.text: Awesome! Go on a Friday or Saturday night. Not only do yout get delicious traditional Mexican fare but also a fun atmosphere!

68qoFvJKPyVTLkiwprlcRA.text: WOW, was I pleased I found Azteca Mexican Restaurant while on my visit to Charlotte. Azteca is NOT just another Mexican Restaurant. The Food and Service were awesome. They have menu choices that stand out from a lot of other Mexican restaurants. Their salsa was very tasty. They will even make fresh Guacamole table side. This is a MUST GO TO!!!  Visited October 2016

JGN3ShT-THg9JRYcICTMUw.text: We came here after we left another restaurant for dinner due to their slow service and it was like night and day!  Sure- this is your typical Mexican joint, but the atmosphere, speedy service where they really cater to you, and the price is where this place sets itself apart. I got the Don Juan entree with chicken, and I had plenty to bring home. The chicken in this dish is worth the price as it's not the dried out shredded chicken in most other plates. The mushroom flavor was evident but reminded me too much of my favorite canned Cream of Mushroom.  The chips and salsa were flowing, the mariachi band kept the patrons moving, and the food was plentiful.  I'll come here anytime I need a fix of quick and tasty Mexican food.

_E_D9aq5O47dfAlLhBd89A.text: I went to Azteca this Christmas for lunch. As you would guess, dining options for lunch on this day are few and far between. I drove past the restaurant, noticed there were about 15 cars there, and being familiar with the chain with other locations in Charlotte, said "what the heck," and pulled in.  This time around I got the Fajita Nachos with steak (you can also order it with chicken), and asked the server to add lettuce and jalapenos. She was polite, asked how my holidays were going, and did a great job making sure that I had everything I needed throughout the time I was there. All of the toppings were fresh, the chips were still warm, and the mixture of everything was just about perfect. What I was most impressed with was the taste of the steak. I believe they marinate the steak, and that gives the meat a certain sweetness that ties everything together. If I could make one suggestion, I would be to maybe cut down a little bit on the amount of green/red peppers that are in the recipe.  Overall, I was very happy with my choice on where to eat Christmas Day lunch. It's a meal that your expectations are somewhat high on, but it's so easy to be let down because of the number of options. The only reason I'm not giving this Azteca 5 stars is because of the salsa that's served as an appetizer, as they do at all Mexican restaurants. It's mediocre at best. The salsa they serve lacks texture, and almost resembles a salsa that has been watered down, with green onions added. If my memory serves me correctly, I wasn't impressed with the salsa that other Azteca restaurants in Charlotte served.  Oh yeah, ask for their homemade house hot sauce! It's a type of salsa verde that made up for their red salsa that's served with the tortilla chips.

8_spc0CODqJcNfdx04O89g.text: Great little Mexican place. Nothing super fancy but for the money you can't go wrong.

kmn-0QeitM4Nl4TeVmObcg.text: My most FAV mexican restaurant EVER! I've been eating here for almost 7 years and won't go anyplace else! It's not fancy, totally authentic, reasonablly priced and most importantly DELICIOUS! Everything from their cheese dip, table-side guac and  homemade flour tortillas to their wonderful staff and service, this place is a must! The staff are so friendy and treat you like family. I'm not saying there's no competion but this place has it all...a complete authentic experience!

yRVISwzOIjbb223zRZYc3w.text: Great Mexican food, ample portions.  I had a large burrito and sides were huge.  Friendly staff. Our group received a complimentary dessert.  Guacamole made tableside was delicious!

vk74KQdQvhka7Xt25l2Nmw.text: The arroz con pollo is killer!  Get there early at lunch!  The lines can be atrocious.  Tasty margaritas are worth trying as well!  The service is always warm and friendly.  Come hungry....there's a lot of food on them there plates!

POmGEL11ymtbF1pz6LRhNw.text: Holy mole!  This is some good Mexican food!  Probably not the most authentic in the world but still mighty tasty.  I've never eaten anything bad here and for a while, my bf and I were on an every weekend Azteca cycle.  I love fresh guacamole and they actually have a woman who comes by your table with all the ingredients on a cart who makes it right there in front of you.  You can even pick what ingredients you want more or less of.....light onions, extra tomatoes for me please!   We told our friends who have lived here for a while that we went to eat there and they had one word for it, "Epic!"  It may not be THAT good, but for queso dip, tacos, and fajitas it's an excellent.  Full bar, margaritas, and a decent beer selection.  An added bonus: the refried beans are actually slightly spicy and tasty, not brown mush out of a can.

awJWDJO8XbWRkystnnCkwg.text: ARROZ CON POLLO!!!!  This place is worth it great staff, great atmosphere, awesome food even down to the little tortilla wit whipped cream and strawberry sauce at the end of the meal. The guy that comes around with the guacamole cart makes killer guacamole. The portions are massive I consider myself a big eater and I have a hard time finishing my meal. The staff is great they come into my store after hours and are just as friendly at that time as they are when at work so I guess that means they are sincere. Great place

YpdpKUed8uP87wpiSMnMdg.text: This is my favorite place to go for more authentic Mexican food.  Azteca has a huge menu and they serve you huge portions.  This place is large so you rarely have to wait to be seated, even on the weekends.  Everything I've eaten here is fantastic, and I have never been able to eat all the food that I'm served.  The best part is that they serve you free sopapillas (tortilla chips with whipped cream, cinammon, and strawberry sauce) with your check.

QOGOeBhP6xrH8v9wB1LKrA.text: We went here for lunch today and it wasn't very good.  Food was bland and didn't taste all that great.  Nothing special...

zT3T00FpGEwgCFeUDgmxSQ.text: Finally, I got to see what table-side guac was!  And it was so cool!  The lady comes out and asked if we wanted one or two (two is gigantic!) and then has all the spices (onions, tomato, jalapeno, etc.) and you tell them exactly how much or how little you want and you taste it until it's exactly how you want it.  Awesome experience!  The food is True to Mexican form, which is hard to find, I'm always finding Tex-Mex around here and you get HUGE portions for the price.  The plate is almost 2 feet wide.  I've never seen such a large portion.  We had the jumbo tableside guac, extra chips and salsa (which unfortunately it's not bottomless chips there :( ), 2 combo platters with 2 tacos and an enchilada, rice, beans, and cole slaw, and a complimentary dessert which they throw in like Chinese restaurants throw in fortune cookies (which was yummy) all for less than $30, plus the servings were so big I had a lot to take home.  I definitely recommend it to anyone that likes real Mexican.  I've only been able to find On the Border around here for tolerable Mexican, but I think this may beat it.  They gave us different types of salsas too.  Even the cole slaw style was good.  I wasn't really a fan of the bland one, too watery, but the second one they gave was great.  They have outside seating which was relaxing.  I wish it wasn't next to a Days Inn, but I didn't see any shady characters running around.  The bathrooms could be a little cleaner tho.
